children.definition: regulation, τῇ δ. τῶν πραγμάτων ἕπεσθαι Plu. Cons.Apoll. 2.102e; τὴν τοῦ νοῦ δ. ἐπονομάζοντας νόμον Pl. Lg. 714a.

data.quote: τὴν τοῦ νοῦ δ. ἐπονομάζοντας νόμον

children.definition: get a motion carried and made law, νόμους Pl. Lg. 628a, cf. D.C. 36.40: abs., Id. 37.50.

children.label: II
children.definition: regulate by law, τι Id. 38.7:— Med., διενομοθετήσαντο τί τίνος ἔργον Pl. Lg. 833e.
fall ill, Hp. Epid. 3.6, Gal. Thras. 7.
separate, part asunder, D.P. 19 (tm.):— Med., put aside for oneself, peculate, D.S. 19.71.
moistening, Gal. 11.740.
right through, τετρήατο prob. in Emp. 84.9.

definition: διανταῖος, α, ον ( ος, ον E. Ion 766 (lyr.)),

children.definition: extending throughout, of ligaments running the whole length of the spine, Hp. Art. 45; right through, διανταίαν πλαγὰν πεπλαγμένος A. Th. 895 (lyr.); διανταίαν οὐτᾶν Id. Ch. 640 (lyr.); δ. βέλει ib. 184; ὀδύνα E. Ion 766 (lyr.); μοῖρα δ. relentless destiny, A. Eu. 334 (lyr.). Adv. -αίως, παθεῖν Antyll. ap. Orib. 44.23.14.
make war against, πρός τινα prob. in Phld. Acad.Ind. p.57M.
able to wet, ἔκκρισις Arist. Mete. 387a26.

drain, exhaust: only metaph., drink to the dregs, endure to the end, νοῦσον Pi. P. 4.293; πόνους E. Andr. 1217 (lyr.); οἰκουρίας Id. HF 1373; βίου χρόνον Ph. 1.161; ὕθλους καὶ λήρους Luc. Pseudol. 25: abs., Heraclit. Incred. 21:— Pass., πόλεμος διηντλήθη Pl. Mx. 241e, cf. Lib. Or. 59.94.
exhaust oneself, to be worried or troubled, περὶ μισθαρίων Hp. Praec. 7.
capable of being wetted, Arist. Mete. 385b10.
pass the night, νύκτα X. HG 5.4.3, cf. PTeb. 268.73 (iii A.D.): abs., Ph. 2.488, Plu. Aem. 16, al.; ἐν τῇ προσευχῇ Ev.Luc. 6.12, cf. Hdn. 1.16.5.
distance traversed, δ. ἡμερήσιαι dayʼs journeys, Ptol. Geog. 1.8.1, cf. 1.9.5.

children.label: II
children.definition: accomplishment, ἔργων Iamb. Myst. 4.3.
= foreg. [διάνυσις] I, δ. ἡμερήσιον Plb. 9.14.8: pl., ib. 15.3.

definition: Διάνυσος, ὁ, ( διαίνω) coined as etym. of Διόνυσος, Corn. ND 30.

children.definition: one must accomplish, Agath. 2.2.
discursively, γιγνώσκειν Ammon. in APr. 25.24.

definition: διανύττω, strengthd. for νύττω, Aristaenet. 1.19, Paul.Aeg. 3.70.

children.definition: nocturnal, read by Theon in S. Ichn. 66 (lyr.).

definition: διανύω (also διᾰνύτω S. Ichn. 64, X. Mem. 2.4.7) [ῠ], pf. -ήνυκα Plb. 4.11.7:—

children.definition: bring quite to an end, accomplish, finish, κέλευθα δ. finish a journey, h.Cer. 380, cf. h.Ap. 108; δίαυλον E. El. 825; τὸ ἑξῆς τῆς ὁδοῦ X. l.c.; τὸν πλοῦν ἀπὸ Τύρου Act.Ap. 21.7; πόνους Vett.Val. 330.9; τὰ προσήκοντα POxy. 1469.4 (iii A.D.): c. acc.loci, πολὺν διὰ πόντον ἀνύσσας having finished oneʼs course over the sea, Hes. Op. 635; πλεῖον δ. traverse, of a point moving along a line, Arist. LI 968a25, cf. Archim. Sph.Cyl.Praef., al.; τόπους Plb. 4.11.7: abs., δ. εἰς τὰς ὑπερβολάς arrive at a place, Id. 3.53.9:— Pass., ὁδὸς διηνυσμένη ib. 63.7: aor. inf. διανυσθῆναι Hsch.: c. part., finish doing a thing, οὔ πω κακότητα διήνυσεν ἣν ἀγορεύων Od. 17.517; but πόνοις σε διδοῦσα διήνυσεν continued giving . ., E. Or. 1663: abs., live, Vett.Val. 58.17.

data.quote: οὔ πω κακότητα διήνυσεν ἣν ἀγορεύων

children.definition: Hsch.

definition: διαξαίνω, aor. -έξᾱνα Gp. 2.6.42, but inf. -ξῆναι Ar. Lys. 578: pf. part. Pass. -εξαμμένος Gal. 8.415, -εξασμένος Dsc. 5.106, Simp. in Cael. 571.6, Paul.Aeg. 3.61:—

children.definition: card, shred, Ar. Lys. 578; ἐσθῆτας Str. 11.14.8; ἔριον Paul.Aeg. l.c.; νεῦρον εἰς ἶνας Alex.Aphr. Pr. 2.52, cf. Gal. l.c.; ἔντερον Ruf. ap. Orib. 7.26.170; of flesh, Paul.Aeg. 6.77, 88:— Pass., of alum, Dsc. l.c., to be dispersed, broken up, Simp. l.c.
κόμην, of the wind, Hld. 3.3; δ. θάλασσαν πτερύγεσσι Opp. H. 5.306; as a punishment, δ. τινά Ael. Fr. 131:— Pass., ὑπὸ Ῥωμαίων ἐκτριβέντες διεξάνθησαν ib. 130.
smooth, polish off, IG 7.3073.138 (Lebad.), Poll. 1.13.

children.label: II
children.definition: erode, Aët. 5.41 ( Pass.).
dry quite up, D.S. 1.10.
quite dry, Gp. 6.2.4, v.l. in Arist. Mete. 352b19, cf. Olymp. ad loc.
to be transferred, Cod.Just. 1.15.2.
fight to the death, τινὶ περί τινος Ar. Eq. 781.
fighting with swords, Plu. Gen.Socr. 2.597f.
stone-dresser, SIG 247 K 1ii55 (Delph.).
cross-piece, Apollod. Poliorc. 177.12.
shave oneself, Arr. Epict. 1.2.29.
filings: metaph., ἰσοτιμίας δ., of εὐγένεια, Chrysipp.Stoic. 3.85.

children.label: II
children.definition: flute of a column, D.S. 13.82.
cut into wrinkles, τὰ περὶ τὸ πρόσωπον διεξυσμένα Arist. Phgn. 808a18 and 35: generally, cut up, Ael. Fr. 85.
contend in the παγκράτιον, Plu. Praec. 2.811d.
jesting, Gloss.
attend children: generally, guide, Pl. Ti. 89d; entertain, amuse, ἡδοναῖς τὴν πόλιν Plu. Per. 11; δ. τὸν καιρόν while away the time, Id. Sert. 16.
take a course of education, X. Cyr. 1.2.15.

definition: διαπαίζω, late fut. -ξω Gal. 8.569: pf. -πέπαιχα Plu. (v. infr.):—

children.definition: jest, Gal. l.c.; διαπαίζων in jest, J. Ap. 2.37 (dub.), D.L. 8.6:— Pass., παιδιὰ καλῶς διαπεπαισμένη a sport well kept up, Pl. Lg. 769a.

children.label: II
children.definition: laugh, jest at, c.acc., J. BJ 5.7.4, Arr. Epict. 2.18.22, Demetr. Eloc. 147, D.L. 4.53: abs., Phld. Lib. p.57O.

children.label: III
children.definition: imitate playfully, [ ὁ Σοφοκλῆς] διαπεπαιχὼς τὸν Αἰσχύλου ὄγκον Plu. Profect. 2.79b.

data.quote: ὁ Σοφοκλῆς] διαπεπαιχὼς τὸν Αἰσχύλου ὄγκον

children.definition: jester, deceiver, Gloss.
continue wrestling, Ar. Eq. 573, Ph. 2.544, J. AJ 1.20.2; πρός τινα Ach.Tat. 4.19: c. dat., νοσήματι struggle with, Gal. 17(1).569.
hard struggle, διαπάλαι πολέμου Plu. Cor. 2, cf. Adul. 2.50f.
brandish, A. l.c.:—but in Pass., to be driven to and fro, of a hunted deer, Opp. H. 2.620.

children.label: II
children.definition: distribute by lot, χθόνα ναίειν διαπήλας A. Th. 731 (lyr.).
grind to powder, E. Ph. 1159.
pass the whole night, Plu. Amat.narr. 2.775d.
complete vigil, D.H. 2.19.
meet, Porph. Abst. 3.10.
Adv., later spelling of διὰ παντός, v. διά A. ΙΙ.1.
look timidly round, Plu. Fab. 11.
hand over to a successor, IG 9(2).1109.64,91 ( Magn. Thess.).
lie in wait for continually, τινά LXX 2 Ki. 3.30.
constant wrangling, 1 Ep.Ti. 6.5.
deflowering of a maiden, Hdn. Epim. 20.
one who deflowers, Gloss.

senses.definition: deflower a maiden, Hdt. 4.168 ( Pass.), Diocl.Com. 16, Antiph. 75, Alex. 314.

children.definition: made to the bride on the morning after the wedding, Amphis 49.
set up statue of, τινά JHS 10.71 ( Lydae).
transfixion, Gloss.

definition: διάπαρσις, εως, ἡ, = foreg., Aret. SA 1.7 (pl.).

children.definition: scented powder to sprinkle over the person, Dsc. 1.7, Antyll. ap. Orib. 10.31.1: freq. in pl., Thphr. Od. 8, Plu. Bruta anim. 2.990c, Plin. HN 13.19, Luc. Am. 39.
stretch out by nailing the extremities, πρὸς σανίδα Hdt. 7.33; of a hide pegged out for tanning, Ar. Eq. 371, cf. Plu. Art. 17.

sprinkle, -πάσας τοῦ ψήγματος ἐς τὰς τρίχας Hdt. 6.125; σμύρνῃ δ. τὴν ὁδόν Eub. 128; δασύποδας ἁλσὶ δ. Alc.Com. 17; μέλανι διαπεπασμένον χρῶμα Arist. HA 526a12; πυρρὰ διαπεπασμένα with red spots, ib. 527b30.
one must powder, prob. in Philum. ap. Aët. 5.128.
endure, sustain, χλεύην POxy. 904.2 (v A.D.).

definition: διαπασῶν, ἡ, i.e. ἡ διὰ πασῶν χορδῶν συμφωνία,

children.definition: concord of the first and last notes, octave; more correctly divisim, τέταται διὰ πασῶν (sc. χορδῶν) Pl. R. 432a; τὸ δὶς διὰ πασῶν Plu. An.procr. 2.1019b.
deceive utterly, Pl. Lg. 738e, Ph. 2.92:— Pass., Arist. HA 496b5.
tread through, τὴν χιόνα Plb. 3.55.2; dub. in Ph. 1.354 codd.
cessation, rest, πόνων Pl. Lg. 824a.
gap, IG 14.352ii48 ( Halaesa).
pause, Arist. Pr. 894a26.

bring to an end, conclude, τὸν βίον, i.e. die, prob. in SIG 494.4 ( Delph., iii B.C.):— Med., rest between times, pause, Pl. Smp. 191c, R. 336b:— Pass., αἱ στρατιαὶ διεπέπαυντο had ceased for the time being, X. HG 4.4.14.
boil up, effervesce, of anger, Nonn. D. 31.24.

definition: διάπεζος, ον, of womenʼs robes, either

children.definition: reaching to the feet or having a border ( πέζα), Callix. 2.
convince, ὁ διαπείθων λόγος dub. in Phld. Ir. p.80 W.:— Pass., BGU 1062.19 (iii A.D.).

threaten violently, Hdt. 7.15; δ. ὡς μηνύσει Id. 2.121.γʹ: c. inf. fut., Plu. Oth. 16:— Med., διαπειλεῖσθαί τινι Aeschin. 1.43, Alex. 306, PPetr. 2p.1: c. inf., forbid with threats, μηθένα φέρειν ὅπλον Plb. 1.78.15; ἄλλα τε δ. καὶ ὡς . . Conon 50.3.
hunger one against the other, have a starving-match, διαπεινᾶμες ( Dor.), with a play on διαπίνομεν, Ar. Ach. 751.
crucial experiment, trial, proof, ἐς διάπειράν τινος ἀπικέσθαι Hdt. 2.28, 77; ἀποπέμπειν ἐς τὴν δ. τινός Id. 1.47; δ. βροτῶν ἔλεγχος Pi. O. 4.18.
tempt, make trial of, τινά LXX 3 Ma. 5.40.

children.label: II
children.definition: attempt, try, c. inf., J. AJ 15.4.2.
pierce through, Man. 2.106 ( Pass.).

make trial or proof of, τῶν Περσέων Hdt. 5.109, cf. 3.14, Cratin.Jun. 7.2; try to impose on a man, Pl. Lg. 921b: c. gen. rei, have experience of a thing, Th. 6.91: abs., ὥσπερ αἴνιγμα συντιθέντι διαπειρωμένῳ Pl. Ap. 27a, cf. Lg. l.c.
attempt obstinately, τὰ ψευδῆ λέγειν Antipho l.c.

children.label: II
children.definition: Act., διαπειρῶν δωροδοκίαις Plu. Pomp. 51.
drive through, σφυρῶν κέντρα E. Ph. 26, cf. Il. 16.405 (tm.); δ. ὀβελούς Iamb. Myst. 3.4.

pierce, transfix, ἥλῳ τὰ στελέχη Gp. 5.36.3; βελόναις τὴν γλῶτταν Plu. Art. 14; λίνῳ Dsc. 2.61:— Pass., διαπεπαρμένος ἥλοις Plu. Vind. 2.567f; τὴν χεῖρα διαπᾰρείς J. AJ 10.1.2; to be interpenetrated, of muscle and flesh, Gal. 8.74.

definition: διάπεισμα (freq. misspelt διά-πισμα), ατος, τό, ( διαπείθω)

children.definition: present, ‘douceur’, PTeb. 311.29 (ii A.D.), POxy. 133.14 (vi A.D.), etc; ‘Kingʼs shilling’ given to recruits, ib. 1103.8 (iv A.D.).
approach, etym. of δασπλῆτις, Sch. Theoc. 2.14.
period of five days, Gal. 19.551, Cat.Cod.Astr. 1.119.9, 121.19; cf. διάτριτος.

send off in different directions, Hdt. 1.48, 84, etc.; ἄλλους ἄλλῃ δ. Th. 8.64; φρουρὰς κατὰ χώραν Id. 4.55; δ. τὴν ἰκμάδα (through the body), Arist. PA 681a30; τὸ πνεῦμα Id. HA 496a32; τὴν φωνὴν εἰς τὸ πρόσω Id. PA 662b22:— Med., send out expeditions, OGI 199.35 ( Adule).

children.label: II
children.definition: send over or across, τινὰ πρός τινα Ar. Pl. 398; τινά τινι Th. 4.123; transmit, BGU 5ii19 (ii A.D.), etc.; ἐπιστολήν Th. 1.129:— Med., Id. 3.75 (possibly Pass.), SIG 741.33 ( Nysa, i B.C.); ἐσθῆτά τινι Ph. 2.43.

children.label: III
children.definition: Med., send messages, περὶ βοηθείας πρός τινα Plb. 5.72.1; πρὸς τοὺς φίλους Plu. Arat. 8.
distribution of nourishment in the body, Hp. Vict. 1.9.
transmission of a letter, Themist. Ep. 16.
mourn throughout, ἐνιαυτόν Plu. Publ. 23.
contend in the πένταθλον, Tz.ad Lyc. 860.
elaborately, Isoc. Ep. 6.6.

bring to a conclusion, λόγους E. Andr. 333; describe thoroughly, τι Pl. Phlb. 47b, etc.; διαπέραινέ μοι tell me all, E. Andr. 1056; δ. ὁδόν Pl. Lg. 625b:— Med., μορφῆς διαπεράνασθαι κρίσιν to get the trial of beauty decided, E. Hel. 26; διαπεράνασθαι λόγον Pl. Phdr. 263e, etc.:— Pass., Iamb. Myst. 7.4.

children.label: II
children.definition: traverse, pass through, λοβόν Aret. SA 2.8 (cf. διαπεράω).
take across, ferry over, Plu. Sull. 27:— Pass., to be carried over, cross, ἐνθεῦτεν διαπεραιωθείς Hdt. 5.23; δ. τὸν ποταμόν Id. 2.124; ἐπεὶ πάντες διεπεπεραίωντο Th. 3.23: in aor. Med., Pl. Ax. 370b.
κολεῶν διεπεραιώθη ξίφη swords were unsheathed, S. Aj. 730.
carrying over, Sch. Th. 3.76.

children.label: II
children.definition: crossing over, Marcian. Peripl. 1.44 (pl.).
strait of the sea, ferry, Str. 6.1.5, Peripl.M.Rubr. 32, Ptol. Geog. 1.13.8.
one must carry to its conclusion, λόγον Pl. Lg. 715e.
penetrating, Sch. Il. 12.439, Eust. 709.48.

go over or across, ῥοάς E. Tr. 1151; πελάγη Isoc. 1.19; δ. ἐπʼ οἶδμα E. IT 395 (lyr.); δ. πόλιν pass through it, Ar. Av. 1264; δ. Ἑλλάδα E. Supp. 117; δ. εἰς Ἰταλίαν Arist. Fr. 485; of Time, δ. τὸν βίον pass through life, X. Oec. 11.7.

children.label: b
children.definition: διαπερᾶν Μολοσσίαν reign through all Molossia, E. Andr. 1248 codd.
pass through, pierce, κνήμην διεπέρασεν Ἀργεῖον δόρυ Id. Ph. 1394; traverse, ἧπαρ, of a vein, Aret. SA 2.8 (cf. διαπεραίνω).
οἶσθα διαπερῶν by traversing, i.e. by experience, A. Th. 994 (lyr.), cf. Sch.

children.label: II
children.definition: reach, arrive at a place, PFlor. 247.9 (iii A.D.).

children.label: III
children.definition: carry over, ὕδωρ ποταμοῦ σῶμα δ. Eub. 151, cf. Luc. DMort. 6[20].1.
slip through like a partridge, Com.Adesp. 87.

definition: διαπέρθω, aor. 1 -έπερσα Pi. Pae. 6.104: aor. 2 -έπρᾰθον Il. 1.367, Ep. inf. -πραθέειν 7.32: aor. Med. -επράθετο in pass. sense, Od. 15.384:—

children.definition: destroy utterly, sack, waste, always of cities, Il.cc.
keep walking about, Ath. 4.157e, 12.539c.
pin or pierce through, σφυρὰ σιδήρῳ D.S. 4.64; τινὰ διαμπάξ Agath. 1.9:— Pass., Id. 2.9, al., Luc. Gall. 24; σαυνίῳ διὰ τοῦ θυρεοῦ διαπερονηθείς D.H. 9.64.
slip away one by one, of soldiers deserting, D. 49.14, 50.
open and spread out, Ar. Lys. 732, 733; τὰς πλεκτάνας, of the polypus, Arist. HA 541b5; ἀετοὺς διαπεπετακότας τοὺς πτέρυγας D.S. 17.115:— Pass., pf. διαπέπ[τ]α[νται] πύλαι prob. in Pi. Dith.Oxy. 2.4.
opening, πόρων Eust. 1842.48.
spread out, unfolded, open, Hp. Cord. 10.

definition: διαπέτομαι( διΐπταμαι Hdn., v. infr.), aor. -επτάμην (v. infr.): aor. Act. -έπτην Luc. DMeretr. 9.4: pres. διαπέταται S. OT 1310 (lyr.) is f.l. for διαπωτᾶται:—

children.definition: fly through, διὰ δʼ ἔπτατο πικρὸς ὀϊστός Il. 5.99; ὁρᾷς τὸν ἁβρὸν οὗ βέλος διέπτατο E. Supp. 860; δ. διὰ τῆς πόλεως Ar. Av. 1217: c. acc., E. Med. 1, Ar. V. 1086.

data.quote: ὁρᾷς τὸν ἁβρὸν οὗ βέλος διέπτατο

children.label: II
children.definition: fly away, vanish, διαπτομένη οἴχεσθαι Pl. Phd. 70a, 84b, etc.; of Time, E. HF 507.

children.label: III
children.definition: fly in all directions, διϊπταμένη ἡ φήμη Hdn. 2.8.7.
gamble, δ. τὴν ἐλπίδα try oneʼs luck at play, Luc. Am. 16.
digest, τροφήν Arist. GA 766b13.

definition: διαπεύθομαι, poet. for διαπυνθάνομαι, A. Ag. 807 (anap.).
διαπέφλοιδεν διακέχυται, and διαπέφρυδεν· χαίρει, διακέχυται, Hsch. διαπεφρυκέναι· διεσκέφθαι, καὶ καθεωρακέναι, Id.

children.definition: panels, LXX 3 Ki. 7.31, 32.

definition: διαπήγιον, τό, = sq., BGU 781 iii8 (i A.D.).

children.definition: cross-bar, Ph. Bel. 54.19, Hero Bel. 83.8, Dioptr. 34, Heliod. ap. Orib. 49.7.1; partition, Hero Aut. 11.9.
small crossbar, Ph. Bel. 64.7.
fix or thrust through, ἀκόντιον διὰ πλευρῶν Antipho 3.3.5; transfix, διέπᾱξε σιδάρῳ Epigr. in PTeb. 3.29 (i B.C.).

children.label: II
children.definition: freeze hard, Thphr. Vent. 54: pf. -πέπηγα, intr., to be frozen, Arist. Mir. 835a30.

children.label: III
children.definition: Med., δ. σχεδίας get them put together, Luc. DMort. 25[12].5.
leap across, τάφρον Ar. Ach. 1178, cf. X. Eq. 3.7: metaph., pass over lightly, Philostr. Her. 2.10: abs., take a leap, of a horse, X. Cyr. 1.4.8.
ooze through, perh. f.l. for -πιδύω, Hp. Hum. 11.
leap apart, form a chasm, of the earth, Lyd. Ost. 53.
leaping or starting through: metaph. in Medic., of blood, etc., transudation through the tissues, Sor. 1.23, v.l. in Hp. Nat.Puer. 21.
λόγον trick out deceitfully, Cratin. 282 (prob. l., cf. πήνηξ).
Apollod. Poliorc. 172.7: as Adj., διάπηγες μοχλοί Ph.Byz. Mir. 4.2.
fastening together, structure, δ. σωματική bodily frame, Herm. ap. Stob. 1.49.69.
make very fat, in Pass., Thphr. CP 6.11.7, Theoc. 16.91.
let water ooze through, Arist. Mete. 350a8.
ooze through, διὰ τῶν πόρων Arist. GA 743a9, cf. Hp. Nat.Puer. 21.
transudation, Hp. Nat.Puer. 21.
press together, Luc. Lex. 11.
oppose by probable argument, ἄλλου ἄλλως εἰκάζοντος καὶ διαπιθανευομένου S.E. M. 8.324.

definition: διαπιθηκίζω, strengthd. for πιθηκίζω, EM 269.38, Suid.

children.definition: to be greatly embittered, πρός τινα Plu. Cohib. 2.457a.
very bitter, ὕδωρ D.S. 2.48, 19.98.
obese, adipose, Ruf. Onom. 175.

fill full, οἰκίας Philostr. Im. 2.27; λόγων τὴν οἰκουμένην Eun. VS p.493D., cf. Nonn. D. 5.194; in early writers in Pass., to be filled with, τινός Th. 7.85; to be satiated or tired, διαπεπλησμένος τινός of one, And. 1.125.
burn, ναῦς Plb. 21.44.30; μοχλὸν διαπρήσας Aen. Tact. 4.2 (nisi leg. -πρίσας):— Pass., swell up (cf. πρήθω), Nic. Al. 341; οἱ μυκτῆρες διαπέπρηνται Hippiatr. 27.
drink one against another, Hdt. 5.18, 9.16, Pl. R. 420e; = προπίνειν, Epig. 8:— Med., δ. ἀνδράσι Hedyl. ap. Ath. 11.486c.

children.label: II
children.definition: drink at intervals, Anaxandr. 57:—but Pass., to be swallowed at a draught, διαπινόμενοι Arist. Pr. 872b27.
sell off, PTeb. 5.192 (ii B.C.), etc.; οὐσίαν Plu. Comp.Lys.Sull. 3.
fall through, Arist. Cael. 313b1.

children.label: II
children.definition: fall away, slip away, escape, ἐν τῇ μάχῃ X. HG 3.2.4; πρός τινα ib. 4.3.18; εἰς τὴν Ἀσπίδα Plb. 1.34.11, etc.
spread abroad, εἰς τὰ στρατεύματα Plu. Galb. 22.
elapse, Arist. Ath. 35.4.

children.label: III
children.definition: fall asunder, crumble in pieces, διαπέσοιμι πανταχῇ Ar. Eq. 695, cf. Pl. Phd. 80c, Arist. Mete. 365b12; burst, of bubbles, Id. Pr. 936b5; rot, LXX Nu. 5.21; perish, διέπεσε πᾶσα γενεὰ ἀνδρῶν ib. De. 2.14; to be missing, lost, of moneys, etc., PEleph. 21.19 (iii B.C.), etc.; of books, to be imperfect, J. AJ 12.2.4.

children.label: b
children.definition: intermittent pulse, Gal. 19.636.
turn out ill, be useless, τὸ συκοφάντημα διέπιπτεν αὐτῷ Aeschin. 2.39, cf. Plb. 5.26.16, PAmh. 2.33.26 (ii B.C.), etc.

make mistakes, ἐν τοῖς σημαινομένοις Chrysipp.Stoic. 3.33, cf. Phld. Ir. p.73 W.: c. gen., fail of, miss, Epicur. Ep. 2p.43U., Phld. Rh. 1.49S.; δ. περὶ τῆς δόξης Socr. Ep. 22; περὶ τῶν μεγίστων Arr. Epict. 2.22.36: abs., err, Phld. Ir. p.91W.; οὐ διαπεσούμεθα Iamb. in Nic. p.63P.; to be cheated, ἐν χρήσει νομίσματος Arr. Epict. 1.7.6.

children.label: IV
children.definition: ἡ διαπίπτουσα or ὁ τόπος ὁ διαπίπτων, Tophet, LXX Je. 19.12, 13.
entrust to one in confidence, τινὶ τὴν πόλιν, τὴν δυναστείαν, Aeschin. 3.8, Plb. 5.40.7; τῷ θεῷ τὰν ὠνάν Rüsch Grammatik der delph.Inschr. p.326 (ii B.C.); also δ. τινὶ περί τινος Aeschin. 1.188.

children.label: II
children.definition: believe thoroughly, τι Arist. PA 673a17, cf. Max.Tyr. 10.7.
have confidence in, believe, PHib. 1.147 (iii B.C.):— Pass., to be trusted or believed, D. 10.51, Aen.Gaz. Thphr. p.18B.
distrust utterly, τινί D. 19.324, Arist. Pol. 1314a17: abs., disbelieve, PSI 4.377.9 (iii B.C.), Aps. Rh. p.287 H.:— Med., mistrust oneself, Plb. 18.46.7.
lead quite astray, Plu. Aet. phys. 2.917e, Arr. Epict. 1.20.10; deceive, cheat, BGU 367 (ii A.D.):— Pass., go astray, wander, D.S. 17.116, Plu. Fr.inc. 11 (v.l.).
putting into shape: setting of a dislocated limb, Gal. 18(2).332.

children.label: II
children.definition: formation, modelling, νεύρου Alex.Aphr. Pr. 2.72; conformation, Gal. 7.26; σώματος Hierocl. in CA 10p.437M.

children.label: III
children.definition: deformation by mirrors, Phlp. in Mete. 28.19.
model, shape, or perh. modelled jug, Sch. Ar. V. 614.
Placit. 1.3.18.
massage of infants, Sor. 1.101.

form, mould, ζῷα Ph. 1.15; ὕλην, ἄρτον, σῶμα, Plu. Def.orac. 2.427b, Pyth. 401f, Him. Or. 14.13; διανοήματα ῥυθμοῖς Jul. Or. 2.78d: metaph., ἐπίνοια J. BJ 7.8.1; δ. τῷ λόγῳ Ael. VH 3.1:— Pass., τέτταρσι διαπλασθέντα προσώποις μῦθον AP 9.542 ( Crin.); δ. τὰ μόρια [τοῦ ἐμβρύου] Arist. GA 740a36, cf. Epicur. Ep. 2p.38U.: metaph., to be concocted, invented, PMonac. 6.47 (vi A.D.).

children.label: II
children.definition: plaster, πηλῷ Thphr. HP 4.15.2.

children.label: III
children.definition: reshape a broken nose, Heliod. ap. Orib. 48.33.5, Gal. 18(1).479.
formative, δύναμις Alex.Aphr. Pr. 1.47, Gal. Nat.Fac. 1.6.
dilate, X. Lac. 2.5; flatten out, Chrysipp.Tyan. ap. Ath. 14.648a.
woof or web, Eust. 1571.56.

weave, plait, σάνδαλα h.Merc. 80; opp. διαλύω, Hdt. 4.67; τὰ τὸν ὄσχεον διαπλέκοντα σώματα Paul.Aeg. 6.62: metaph., θρῆνον δ. Pi. P. 12.8; ἀγὰν πάγχυ δ. to try every twist, wind all ways, ib. 2.82:— Med., διαπλέξασθαι κόμας plait oneʼs hair, Aristaenet. 1.25: — Pass., ψυχὴ διαπλακεῖσα interwoven [with matter] . ., Pl. Ti. 36e, cf. Plot. 1.1.3.

children.label: II
children.definition: διαπλέξαντος τὸν βίον εὖ finish the web of oneʼs life, Hdt. 5.92.ζʹ; δ. βίοτον λιπαρῷ γήραϊ Pi. N. 7.99; ἁμέραν prob. in Alcm. 23.38; ἀσκητικόν τινα βίον Pl. Lg. 806a, cf. Com.Adesp. 231: without βίον, δ. ζῶν ἡδέως Ar. Av. 754.
cross-dyke, PLille 1i6 (iii B.C.).

sail through a strait or gap, Th. 4.24, Plb. 14.10.12; sail across, Μέγαράδε Lys. 12.17; εἰς Αἴγιναν Ar. V. 122, etc.: c.acc., δ. τὸ πέλαγος Plu. Apophth.reg. 2.206d, IG 14.1976: metaph., δ. βίον sail through life, make lifeʼs voyage, Pl. Phd. 85d.
flow through, pass, τὰ ψαμμία σὺν τοῖσι οὔροισι δ. Aret. SD 2.3.

data.quote: τὰ ψαμμία σὺν τοῖσι οὔροισι δ.

children.definition: brim-full, τινός Cratin. 280, Plu. Vind. 2.551a: pl., διάπλεα Thphr. CP 2.1.4: fem. διάπλεαι Plu. Tim. 11.

spar, LXX Ex. 2.13; τινί Luc. Anach. 11: generally, skirmish with, ἱππεῦσι Plu. Luc. 31: metaph., wrangle, δ. τοῖς γυναίοις Id. Tim. 14; πρὸς γύναιον Id. Amat. 2.760a, cf. Agath. 2.29: c. dat. modi, δ. τοῖς σκώμμασι Plu. Sull. 2:—late in Act., Horap. 1.70.

definition: διαπλήκτισις, εως, ἡ, = sq., Sch. Il. 1.138.

children.definition: sparring, disputing, wrangling, πρὸς Σωκράτην περί τινος Plu. QConv. 2.710c (pl.); δ. τε καὶ ὀργαί Porph. Marc. 2.
πληρόω:— Pass., -πεπληρωμένοι λαφύρων Aen.Tact. 16.8.
break in pieces, split, cleave, δρῦς Il. 23.120 (v.l. διαπλίσσοντες): aor. inf. -πλῆξαι read by Aristarch. in Od. 8.507.
stand or walk with the legs apart, διαπεπλιγμένος long-shanked, straddling, Archil. 58: so in pf. part. Act., στόμα διαπεπλῐχός wide open, Hp. Mul. 2.167, cf. Hsch., and v. foreg.
intermixture, Hp. Alim. 11.

children.label: II
children.definition: crooked ways, Aq. Ps. 124(125).5.
= sq., σκάφιον Str. 17.1.50.
interwoven, plaited, Hld. 2.3.

children.label: I
children.definition: Adj., sailing across or sailing continually, δ. καθίστασαν λεών they kept them at the oar, A. Pers. 382.

children.label: II
children.definition: Subst., διάπλους, ὁ, a voyage across, passage, πρὸς τὸ Κήναιον Th. 3.93; ἀπὸ τῆς οἰκείας Id. 6.31.
room for sailing through, passage, δυοῖν νεοῖν for two ships abreast, Id. 4.8.
cross-channel, Pl. Criti. 118e.
unfold, Heb. Ge. 38.29; διαπλοῦσθαι v.l. for διαπνεῖσθαι, X. Smp. 2.25 as quoted by Ath. 11.504d.

definition: διαπλύνω, strengthd. for πλύνω, Ar. Fr. 686.

children.definition: A.R. 2.629, Nic. Al. 559, AP 7.23 ( Antip. Sid.).

definition: διαπνείω, poet. for διαπνέω, Nonn. D. 29.201.

children.definition: breeze, dub.l. in Hp. Aër. 19 (pl.).
exhaling, Gp. 5.28.1.
promoting exhalation, Aret. CA 1.1.
easily dissipated, volatile, ἀήρ Alex.Aphr. in Sens. 36.4.
blow through, of air, δ. τὸ σῶμα Arist. Pr. 967a3, cf. Mete. 370b6, etc.:— Pass., αὔραις διαπνεῖσθαι X. Smp. 2.25, cf. Arist. HA 518a16, D.S. 5.82.
admit air, ἀπόφραξον ἅπαντα ὡς μὴ διαπνέειν Hero Spir. 2.21.

children.label: II
children.definition: breathe between times, get breath, Plb. 27.9.10, Plu. Cim. 12, Ph. 1.90, al.; ἐκ δυσχερείας Plb. 31.4.1.

children.label: III
children.definition: disperse in vapour, evaporate, Arist. Resp. 479a17, PA 671a20, cf. Ph. 2.42: so,

children.label: IV
children.definition: Pass., διαπίπτειν καὶ διαπνεῖσθαι Pl. Phd. 80c; δ. καὶ σήπεται τὸ σῶμα Arist. de An. 411b9.
dissipate by exhalation, Aret. SA 1.7:— Pass., Gal. 15.377 (also intr. in pass. sense, διέπνευσε τὸ ἄλγος Aret. CA 1.10).
Pass., of plants, exhale, διαπνεῖται καὶ ἐξατμίζεται Thphr. CP 1.1.3, cf. M.Ant. 6.16; of human beings, perspire, Id. 3.1, Gal. 15.377:—so Med., Hp. Alim. 28.
outlet, vent for the wind, Arist. Mete. 368b9: pl., gap, interstice, Erot. s.v. διαρόλχας; pores, Aret. CA 2.7; organs of respiration, Id. SA 1.5.

children.label: II
children.definition: exhalation, Thphr. CP 16.6.

children.label: III
children.definition: transpiration, Hp. Alim. 28, Alex.Aphr. Pr. 2.60, Gal. 15.180, Aret. SA 1.10; of vapours or humours, Id. CA 1.1, CD 2.13.

children.label: IV
children.definition: expulsion of flatus, Id. SD 2.8.

definition: διάπνοια, ἡ, = foreg. [διαπνοή] I, Poll. 2.219, Gp. 7.6.10, Simp. in Cael. 524.10.

children.label: II
children.definition: opening, gap, Pall. in Hp.Fract. 12.283C.
measure with the foot, Hsch., EM 269.25.
jumping about: a kind of dance, Poll. 4.99.
to be utterly separated, depart, Ph. 1.255.
keep dying, διαμάχεσθαι καὶ δ. Plb. 16.31.8.
complete a transaction, BGU 1261.13 (i B.C.), PTheb.Bank 126.4.

variegate, adorn with variety, mostly metaph., τοῖς διαιτήμασι Hp. Vict. 3.68; ποίησιν Isoc. 9.9; literally, δ. τι ἀργύρῳ καὶ χρυσῷ Plu. Sert. 14:— Pass., μέλανι δ., to be dappled, Arist. HA 503b5: metaph., δ. ἐκ . . to be blended of various sorts, Pl. Lg. 693d, cf. 863a; ἀπάταις τὰ πολλὰ δ. τοῦ πολέμου Plu. Lys. 7, cf. Iamb. Myst. 7.3.

data.quote: ἀπάταις τὰ πολλὰ δ. τοῦ πολέμου

children.definition: variegated, Hp. Coac. 603; ἄκανθα δ. τὴν χρόαν Arist. Fr. 269; δ. ῥάβδοις striated, Id. HA 525a12; δ. ψῆφοι Str. 5.2.6.
ἀοιδά Lyr.Alex.Adesp. 20.6.

children.label: II
children.definition: clad in embroidered robes, Luc. Nec. 12.
feed: metaph. of educators, βίον Man. 4.419.

carry a war through, Hdt. 7.158; δ. τὸν πόλεμον Pl. Criti. 108e; δ. τινί fight it out with one, X. An. 3.3.3, Plb. 3.2.3, Plu. Fab. 19; πρός τινα D.S. 14.99:— Pass., διαπεπολεμήσεται [ὁ πόλεμος] the war will be at an end, Th. 7.14, cf. 25, Jul. Or. 2.55c.

children.label: II
children.definition: carry on the war, Th. 6.37.
finishing of a war, Th. 7.42.
carry a siege to its conclusion, Th. 3.17.
party-strife, Plu. Garr. 2.510c (pl.); αἱ πρός τινας δ. Cic. Att. 9.4.2.
to be a political rival, Aeschin. 3.194, Harp. s.v. διαγορεύων; δ. Περικλεῖ, of Thucydides son of Melesias, Marcellin. Vit.Thuc. 28.
political opponent, prob. in App. Hisp. 8 ( -πολῖται codd.).
destroy utterly, Thphr. HP 8.10.3.
carry the procession to an end, Luc. Nec. 16; ᾽Ράριον ὀργειῶνα νόμῳ -πομπεύουσα prob. in Hermesian. 7.19.

children.label: II
children.definition: carry all round, ὕδωρ Critias 1.7D.
interchange of messages, negotiation, πρὸς τὰς πόλεις Th. 6.41 (pl.); φίλων, ἐραστῶν, App. BC 5.71, POxy. 471.61 (pl.): sg., App. Hisp. 91.
Ar. Pl. 651.
exported, D.S. 2.49, Opp. C. 3.47.

work out with labour, elaborate, Isoc. 5.85; cultivate, practise, δ. γράμματα Pl. Lg. 810b, cf. R. 535c; τὰ πρὸς ἀγῶνας συντείνοντα Arist. Pol. 1341a11; exercise, σώματα X. Cyn. 4.10; σώματα δρόμοις καὶ πάλαις Plu. Lyc. 14; αὑτὸν Id. Dem. 5; στρατόν App. Syr. 43; τοὺς νέους Luc. Anach. 18:— Med., διαπονεῖσθαι ἐπιτηδεύματα, τέχνας, Pl. Lg. 846d, cf. Phdr. 273e, X. Mem. 2.1.33:— Pass., Pl. Criti. 118c, Ep. 326d, etc.; οἴκου . . οὐχ ὡς τὰ πρόσθʼ ἄριστα διαπονουμένου managed, governed, A. Ag. 19; διαπονηθῆναι τὴν μουσικήν to be taught it thoroughly, Plu. Per. 4; διαπεπονημένοι veterans, D.S. 11.7; ὄψων . . περιττῶς διαπεπονημένων Plu. Luc. 40.

data.quote: οἴκου . . οὐχ ὡς τὰ πρόσθʼ ἄριστα διαπονουμένου

children.definition: till or cultivate completely, χώραν Plb. 4.45.7:— Pass., Hell.Oxy. 12.5.
Pass., to be worn out, troubled, Act. Ap. 4.2, 16.18, POxy. 743.22 (i B.C.).

children.label: II
children.definition: to work hard, δ. τῇ διανοίᾳ καὶ τῷ σώματι Arist. Pol. 1339a8, cf. Aristeas 92; περὶ τὸ σῶμα Arist. EN 1178a26; περὶ τὰ δημιουργικὰ τεχνήματα Pl. Lg. 846d: c. inf., δ. πᾶν ἰσόρροπον ποιεῖν X. Smp. 2.17: — Med., δ. τὸ πᾶσαν πίστιν λαβεῖν Pl. Lg. 966c; δ. περὶ τὸν γόνον Arist. GA 759b1; οἱ διαπονούμενοι the hard-working, hardy, opp. ἄπονοι, X. Lac. 5.8; to be hard-worked, of hounds, Arr. Cyn. 32.1, al.

data.quote: δ. τῇ διανοίᾳ καὶ τῷ σώματι

children.definition: hard labour, exercise, τὰ περὶ τὸν πόλεμον δ. Pl. Lg. 813d.

children.label: II
children.definition: work, τὰ τῶν τεκτόνων δ. Id. Criti. 114e; achievement, work done, βασιλέως Procop. Aed. 2.7; thing achieved, reward of toil, Id. Goth. 4.19.
deal unfairly, πρός τινα D.H. Is. 3.
working at, preparing, πυροῦ Plu. QConv. 2.693d. -ητέον, one must work hard at, Ph. 2.235.
most elaborately, dub. l. in Ph. 2.20.
exercised, hardy, δ. τὰ σώματα Plu. Mar. 26, al., cf. Onos. 1.1.
worn out, σῶμα δ. πρός τι Plu. Sanit. 2.135f.

children.label: II
children.definition: Adv. -νως with labour or toil, Id. Fab. 1.
beyond sea, γᾶ A. Ch. 352 (lyr.); στράτευμα Hermipp. 58; πόλεμοι Th. 1.141; λήμματα revenues, Antiph. 196.8; πρεσβεία IGRom. 4.881 ( Tacina).

children.label: II
children.definition: across the sea, δ. πέτεσθαι Alex. 210; ναύτης δ. μονομάχος Secund. Sent. 18.
wandering over the sea, dub. in Lyr.Alex. Adesp. 20.13.
procession of heavenly bodies, Pl. Epin. 982c.

children.label: II
children.definition: journey, metaph., ἡ τοῦ λόγου δ. Id. Criti. 106a.

children.label: III
children.definition: mediation, Id. Epin. 984e.
Il. 8.227, Hsch.
Suid.
which may be traversed, Apollon. Lex. s.v. ἁμαξιτός, Sch. X. An. 1.2.21.
carry over, conduct through, X. An. 2.5.18.

children.label: II
children.definition: Med., with aor. Pass. διεπορεύθην:— pass across, ἐς Εὔβοιαν Hdt. 4.33: c. acc., go through, Πελοπόννησον Th. 5.52; χώραν X. An. 3.3.3; δ. τὰς ὁδούς Pl. Lg. 845a; στόμα διʼ οὗ μέλη τε καὶ ἔπη δ. Satyr. Vit.Eur.Fr. 39xx14; δ. γραμμήν travel along a line, Arist. EN 1174b1, cf. Archim. Spir. 12: abs., Th. 1.107, Pl. Phd. 85d, Arist. PA 640b15; οἱ διαπορευόμενοι the passers-by, Aen.Tact. 32.10.

data.quote: στόμα διʼ οὗ μέλη τε καὶ ἔπη δ.

children.definition: go through, detail, εὐεργεσίας Plb. 16.26.2; perform, τὰς κρούσεις Id. 30.22.5.
elapse, BGU 1116.11, al. (i B. C.).

to be quite at a loss, to be in doubt or difficulty, τί χρὴ δρᾶν Pl. Lg. 777c; ἐπὶ τοῖς συμβαίνουσι Plb. 4.71.5: in aor. Pass., διηπορήθη Aeschin. 2.34: pf. Pass., διηπορημένος Plu. Alex. 25:— Med., δ. ὑπʼ αἰσχύνης Pl. Phdr. 237a.
to be in want, Arist. Oec. 1353a26.

children.label: II
children.definition: go through all the ἀπορίαι, Id. Pol. 1276b36, al.: but,

ἀπορέω, raise an ἀπορία, start a difficulty, Id. EN 1096a11; ἔστι δὲ τοῖς εὐπορῆσαι βουλομένοις προὔργου τὸ διαπορῆσαι καλῶς Id. Metaph. 995a28; πὲρί τινος Plb. 4.20.2, Phld. Sign. 21; εἰ . . Epicur. Fr. 21:— Med., διαπορεῖσθαί τι περί τινος Pl. Sph. 217a:— Pass., to be matter of doubt or discussion, Pl. Sph. 250e, Arist. Metaph. 1086a19, al.; τὸ διαπορούμενον Pl. Lg. 799e; τὸ διαπορεῖσθαι Arist. EN 1101a35; τὸ διαπορηθέν Id. Pol. 1282b8: impers., διαπορεῖται περί τινος a question arises about . ., Id. HA 631b2.

data.quote: ἔστι δὲ τοῖς εὐπορῆσαι βουλομένοις προὔργου τὸ διαπορῆσαι καλῶς

children.definition: vexed question, Arist. APo. 93b20 (pl.), al.

children.label: II
children.definition: restlessness, Hp. Acut. 42.
doubting, perplexity, ὑπέρ τινος Plb. 28.3.6; εἰ δεῖ . . Id. 35.5.1.
one must raise questions, Plb. 36.17.12, Ph. 1.288, Longin. 2.1.
at a loss, hesitating, Plu. Pyth. 2.395a.

children.label: II
children.definition: Adv. -κῶς in the form of a question, περιοδεῦσαι Hermog. Inv. 4.3.
Il. 2.691, Th. 6.102, D.H. 8.50, etc.:— Pass., to be utterly ruined, A. Pers. 714, S. Aj. 896 (lyr.), E. Hel. 111, Paus. 7.17.1, D.C. 47.45.
carry over or across a river or strait, Hdt. 4.141, Acus. 29J., etc.; carry a message from one to another, Hdt. 9.4:— Pass., to be ferried across, BGU 1188.10 (i B.C.).
transmit, θεοῖς τὰ παρʼ ἀνθρώπων καὶ ἀνθρώποις τὰ παρὰ θεῶν Pl. Smp. 202e, cf. Procl. Inst. 148, Iamb. Myst. 1.5; κλῆρον εἰς τοὺς ἐκγόνους Jul. Or. 2.81c.

data.quote: θεοῖς τὰ παρʼ ἀνθρώπων καὶ ἀνθρώποις τὰ παρὰ θεῶν

children.label: II
children.definition: δ. ποταμόν, of ferry-boats, ply across a river, Hdt. 1.205, 5.52: abs., cross over, Iamb. VP 2.11.
transmitting, mediating, of certain spiritual beings, Orac. ap. Dam. Pr. 339; τὸ ὄνομα τῶν ἰύγγων Procl. in Cra. 33 P., cf. eund. in Alc. p.69 C.
Questions, Problems, title of work by Epicurus, D.L. 10.27; διαπορίας τοῖς ἰατροῖς παρέχειν Gal. 5.721.
furnish, render, POxy. 977 (iii A. D.).
put the hand through the πόρπαξ, Hsch.
shot with purple, ἄνθη Dsc. 1.11; ἐσθάς Melissa Ep. 1.

dispatch, χρήματα εἰς Χίον D. 35.54, cf. Plb. 5.17.9, D.S. 19.30; κήρυκας Supp.Epigr. 2.261.6 ( Delph., iii B. C.):— Pass., τοῦ παρʼ ἡμῶν -ομένου παιδαρίου UPZ 39.18 (ii B. C.); of a letter, Plb. 5.42.7; of scouts, Id. 18.22.2:— Med. in act. sense, IG 12(7).32.15 ( Amorgos), SIG 692.56 ( Delph., ii B.C.); send as a representative, POxy. 286.26 (i A. D.), etc.
sending of messages, Plb. 5.37.3 (pl.), OGI 248.58 (ii B.C.); πρεσβειῶν D.H. 7.12.
carry safe through, Arr. Ind. 37.5.
discuss or examine thoroughly, τοῦτον τὸν λόγον Pl. Phd. 77d; τὴν αἰτίαν ib. 95e.

children.label: II
children.definition: gain by trading, Ev.Luc. 19.15.

children.label: III
children.definition: accomplish, τι πρὸς τοὺς θεούς Iamb. Myst. 5.16.
practicable, Isoc. Ep. 6.8.
effective, operative, Dam. Pr. 34.
accomplishment of ends, δ. πολιτικαί Pl. Smp. 184b, cf. Ph. 1.429; action, agency, J. AJ 17.1.1, Iamb. Myst. 4.3.
sale to various purchasers, D.H. 7.29, Plu. Sull. 33, POxy. 83.8 (iv A. D.).

children.label: II
children.definition: farming out, προσόδων, τῶν τελωνικῶν, PTeb. 8.15 (iii B. C.), POxy. 44.4 (i A. D.).

pass over, c. gen., διέπρησσον πεδίοιο they made their way over the plain, Il. 2.785, 3.14; also οἵ κε . . διαπρήσσωσι κέλευθον may finish their journey, Od. 2.213, cf. 429: of Time, c. part., ἤματα . . διέπρησσον πολεμίζων I went through days in fighting, Il. 9.326; κεν . . εἰς ἐνιαυτὸν ἅπαντα οὔ τι διαπρήξαιμι λέγων I should not finish speaking . ., Od. 14.197:— Med., διαπραξάμενος βίον Alex. 262.2 (dub.).

children.label: II
children.definition: bring about, accomplish, Hdt. 9.94; δ. τινί τι get a thing done for a man, Id. 3.61, cf. A. Eu. 953 (lyr.): c. inf., X. Smp. 5.9: abs., Ar. Eq. 93:— Pass., ἐπʼ ἔργοις διαπεπραγμένοις καλῶς A. Ch. 739:—freq. in Med., Hdt. 1.2, 2.2, Ar. Lys. 518, etc.; διʼ ἑρμηνέων Hdt. 4.24; οὐδὲν καινὸν διαπράττονται D. 35.1: pf. Pass. in med. sense, τὸ αὐτὸ διαπεπραγμένοι εἰσὶν ὥσπερ ἂν εἰ . . Pl. Grg. 479a; πολλοῖς πολλὰ παρὰ τοῦ πάππου ἀγαθὰ διεπέπρακτο X. Cyr. 4.2.10, cf. An. 2.3.25; ὃ οὗτοι διαπεπραγμένοι εἰσί D. 35.26, cf. Din. 1.97, Isoc. 4.137; τοὺς ἀνήκεστα δ. Theodect. ap. Arist. Rh. 1399b4, cf. Men. Per.Fr. 1: also strictly in sense of Med., effect for oneself, gain oneʼs point, Hdt. 9.41; τὸ ἴδιον Antipho 5.61; φιλίαν δ. πρός τινα X. An. 7.3.16; πλοῖα παρά τινος ib. 6.2.17: c. inf., δ. τῶν ἀγγέλων γενέσθαι Pl. R. 360a; δ. ὥστε folld. by inf., Lys. 16.15, Pl. Grg. 478e, by ind., X. An. 4.2.23; δ. μὴ καίειν ib. 3.5.5.

data.quote: τὸ αὐτὸ διαπεπραγμένοι εἰσὶν ὥσπερ ἂν εἰ . .
πολλοῖς πολλὰ παρὰ τοῦ πάππου ἀγαθὰ διεπέπρακτο

children.definition: Med., get for oneself, obtain, πλοῖα ib. 6.2.17, cf. 3.2.29.

children.label: III
children.definition: make an end of, destroy, in Pass., A. Pers. 260 (lyr.), al., S. Tr. 784, E. Hel. 858; διαπέπρακται τὰ Καρχηδονίων Plu. Fab. 5.

children.label: IV
children.definition: Med., intrigue successfully, Aeschin. 3.232 (so in Act., διαπρήσσει· ἀπατᾶ, ψεύδεται, Hsch.).
soothe, Philostr. VA 6.14, VS 1.21.5.
magnificence, Aq. Ps. 28(29).2, al.

distinguished, νᾶσος Pi. I. 5(4).44; ἀρετή Th. 2.34; ἐσθῆτι καὶ κόσμῳ δ. Democr. 195, cf. E. Supp. 841, IA 1588; γυναικομίμῳ μορφώματι Id. Antiop. iiA 7 A.; τὸ δ. magnificence, Th. 6.16. Adv. -πῶς magnificently, σκηνὴ δ. κεκοσμημένη Plu. Alc. 12; δ. ἀγωνίσασθαι Id. Mar. 28, J. BJ 7.1.2 ( Comp.): Sup. -πέστατα D. 50.7.
remarkably, Sch. E. Or. 1483.
appear prominent or conspicuous, strike the eye, h.Merc. 351, Pi. O. 1.2; διαπρέπον κακόν A. Pers. 1007 (lyr.).
to be eminent, ἔν τινι AP 9.513 ( Crin.); ἐπί τινι Luc. Salt. 9, cf. D.C. 68.6; κάλλει, ὥρας ἀκμῇ, Plu. Amat. 2.771e, D.C. 42.34: c. gen., δ. πάντων ἀψυχία E. Alc. 642.
to be suitable, κτητικὴ λεχθεῖσα ἂν διαπρέψειεν Pl. Sph. 219c.

children.label: II
children.definition: adorn, E. Fr. 185.
reciprocal embassy, Plb. 5.67.11.
send embassies, εἰς τὰς πόλεις X. HG 3.2.24, cf. SIG 633.121( Milet., ii B.C.), Plb. 1.11.11, D.S. 11.68, Plu. Sert. 23; τισί D.C. 45.43:— later in Act., serve as envoy, PPetr. 3p.150.
App. Gall. 18 (pl.); ἐς ἀλλήλους Id. Syr. 2.
Paul.Aeg. 6.18:— Pass., Sor. 1.80; cf. διαπρίζει· διαπερᾷ, Hsch.
sawn through, θύρα Demioprat. ap. Poll. 10.24.

saw through, saw asunder, Ar. Eq. 768, cj. in Aen.Tact. 4.2 (cf. διαπίμπρημι); split, κύμινον Jul. Caes. 312a:— Pass., Hp. VC 21; -πεπρισμένα [ξύλα] SIG 2587.304; διαπεπρισμένα ἡμίσεʼ . . ὡσπερεὶ τὰ σύμβολα Eub. 70: metaph., διεπρίοντο ταῖς καρδίαις Act.Ap. 7.54, cf. 5.33; also εἰς πλείω δ. τὴν Παλαιστίνην Lib. Ep. 334.

children.label: II
children.definition: δ. τοὺς ὀδόντας gnash the teeth, Luc. Cal. 24.

children.label: III
children.definition: διαπρίεται· διαγοράζει, μαίνεται, Hsch.
sawing up into planks, SIG 248 N 8 ( Delph., iv B. C.).
Hp. VC 21.
continue to propose, τι Plb. 4.13.7.
going through, piercing, in Hom. only as Adv., πρὼν πεδίοιο διαπρύσιον τετυχηκώς a hill piercing into, running out into, the plain, Il. 17.748.
piercing, thrilling, ἤϋσεν δὲ διαπρύσιον he gave a piercing cry, 8.227; δ. κιθαρίζων h.Ven. 80: in late Prose, τορόν τι βοῶν καὶ δ. Agath. 4.11.

children.label: II
children.definition: Adj., Ἀπείρῳ διαπρυσία far-stretching, Pi. N. 4.51.
piercing, ὀλολυγαί h.Ven. 19; ὄτοβος S. OC 1479 (lyr.); κέλαδος E. Hel. 1308 (lyr.): in late Prose, οἰμωγαί J. BJ 2.1.2.
δ. κεραϊστής a downright thief, h.Merc. 336; δ. πόλεμος open war, D.L. 2.143.
Adv. -ίως loudly, ἱστορίας μαρτυρία κηρύττουσα δ. D.S. 11.38: metaph., intensely, μισεῖσθαι ὑπό τινος Sch. Ar. Pax 481.
stutter much, Luc. Somn. 8.
clean with or as with a feather, Hp. Acut. 58, Aret. CD 1.8.
flutter about, Ps.-Plu. Fluv. 6.4.
cleaning with a feather, v.l. in Hp. Acut. 58, cf. Erot.
winnow, sift, EM 125.43.

scare away, startle and scatter, ἐπέεσσι διεπτοίησε γυναῖκας Od. 18.340; strike with panic, στρατὸν . . φόβος διεπτόησε E. Ba. 304; with personal subject, Plu. Cleom. 5; τοὺς ἀντιπάλους Them. Or. 21.257b:— Pass., to be panic-stricken, δείσαντες διεπτοήθημεν Pl. R. 336b, cf. Plu. Caes. 10, etc.; of horses, Plb. 3.51.5.

children.label: II
children.definition: Pass., = πτοέω II, διεπτόηντο ταῖς ὁρμαῖς πρὸς τὸς Τίτον Plu. Flam. 5.
violent excitement, Pl. Lg. 783c.
spreading out fanwise, τῶν ἐπιπέδων Procl. Hyp. 5.110; explication, Gal. 1.305.
open and spread out, unfold, disclose: metaph., διαπτυχθέντες ὤφθησαν κενοί S. Ant. 709, cf. E. Hipp. 985, Pl. Lg. 858e ( Pass.); σύμβολα Iamb. Protr. 21; λόγῳ δ. MoschioTrag. 6.
split open, κράνος D.S. 17.20; open up, τὸ ἐπιγάστριον Gal. 2.520.

children.label: II
children.definition: fold one with another, intertwine, Arist. GA 720b17.
fold, folding leaf, δέλτου διαπτυχαί, γραμμάτων δ., E. IT 727, 793.

spit upon, τινός Ael. NA 4.22: abs., Gal. 13.46: metaph., c. acc., ὁ σεμνὸς ἀνὴρ καὶ διαπτύων τοὺς ἄλλους D. 18.258, cf. Lib. Or. 57.53, al.; of food, Plu. Virt. et vit. 2.101c; δ. τὸν χαλινόν, Lat. frenum respuere, Philostr. Im. 2.5:— Pass., D.Chr. 38.38.

data.quote: ὁ σεμνὸς ἀνὴρ καὶ διαπτύων τοὺς ἄλλους

children.definition: stumble, slip, Philem. 60; error, Chrysipp.Stoic. 2.215, Phld. Herc. 1251.5; failure, opp. ἐπίτευγμα, Id. Po. 5.21; μεγάλοις δ. περιπίπτειν fall in with great losses, IPE 12.32.55 ( Olbia), cf. SIG 364.62 ( Ephesus); loss, deficiency in accounts, PHib. 1.52.9 (iii B.C.), etc.
fall, Gal. 18(1).506: chiefly metaph., failure, Epicur. Fr. 556; ἀγωνία φόβος διαπτώσεως Stoic. 3.98, cf. Phld. Lib. p.280 O., Herc. 1251.7, S.E. M. 7.423, Plu. Praec. 2.800a, etc.
suppurate, Hp. Aph. 4.82, etc.
collection of pus, Hp. Prog. 7 (pl.).
suppuration, Hp. Prog. 7, Sor. 1.76.
promoting suppuration, Gal. 11.118.
suppurate throughout, Hp. VC 2, M.Ant. 4.39:—later in Act., Aret. SD 1.9.
spar, fight with, τινί X. Cyr. 7.5.53, Arr. Epict. 2.21.11, etc.: abs., of cocks, Luc. Anach. 37: metaph., Id. Gall. 22.
gate-toll, Arist. Oec. 1348a26, PTeb. 8.19 (iii/ii B.C.).

search out by questioning, find out, τήν τινων συνουσίαν . . περὶ τῶν λόγων τίνες ἦσαν Pl. Smp. 172a, etc.; τί τινος something from one, Plu. Cat.Mi. 16; δ. τοῦ θεοῦ, πῶς χρή . . Pl. R. 469a: abs., Id. Hp.Mi. 369d.

data.quote: τήν τινων συνουσίαν . . περὶ τῶν λόγων τίνες ἦσαν

children.definition: suppurating, Hp. Aph. 7.45.
suppurate, Hippiatr. 16, 20.
to be thoroughly heated, Hp. Steril. 234.
heat thoroughly:— Pass., metaph., glow with anger, Hsch.
cautery irons, Gal. 18(1).376.
set on fire, E. Cyc. 694: Pass., metaph., τῷ θυμῷ διεπυροῦτο Plu. Phoc. 6; to be consumed with thirst, LXX 4 Ma. 3.15.
red-hot, Anaxag. A.1, al., Hp. Aër. 17 , E. Cyc. 631, Arist. Pr. 954a18; σίδηρος Epicur. Fr. 346b; διάπυρα, τά, embers, Pl. Ti. 58c; extremely hot, πέτραι δ. ὑπὸ τοῦ ἡλίου Porph. Abst. 1.13.
inflamed, Hp. VM 18.

ardent, fiery, Pl. R. 615e, Lg. 783a ( Sup.); δ. πρὸς ὀργήν, πρὸς δόξαν, Plu. Gen.Socr. 2.577a, Luc. 4; ἐραστής Procop. Pers. 2.12; δ. μῖσος Plu. Arat. 3. Adv. -ρως ardently, προσέχειν σχολῇ εὐσεβείας Jul. Ep. 89a; ἐρασθῆναί τινος Ael. VH 2.4.
using fire, χρεία Max.Tyr. 10.8.
juggle, h.Merc. 357.
bright red, Xenocr. 15.

communicate by beacon, τινί App. Mith. 79: metaph., blazon abroad as by beacon-fires, τὰς πράξεις τῇ δόξῃ εἰς ἅπαντας τοὺς ἀνθρώπους Plu. Demetr. 8: c.gen., Philostr. VA 2.22 (v.l. διαπῠρ-σαίνω): — Med., make signals by beacons, Plb. 1.19.7.

data.quote: τὰς πράξεις τῇ δόξῃ εἰς ἅπαντας τοὺς ἀνθρώπους

definition: διαπύρσιος μέγας, διαβόητος, Hsch.:—also διαπύρσιον· μέγα, διαπορεύσιμον, ἐξάκουστον (i.e. διαπρύσιον) , κτλ., Cyr.

children.definition: severe inflammation, Sor. 1.82.

children.label: II
children.definition: thorough heating, PHolm. 2.7.
heard of, well-known, δ. γίγνεσθαι Hdn. 2.12.2.
spirt or spirt out, Arched. 3.12.
sell publicly, X. HG 4.6.6, Plu. Oth. 4; sell entirely, πάντα τά τινος PLips. 35.17 (iv A. D.):— Pass., SIG 695.62 ( Magn. Mae.).
form a callus thoroughly, of a broken bone, Hp. Art. 21.
curse, Aristeas 311.
scourging, prob. in POxy. 1873 (v A. D.).
strike through, διὰ σαρκὸς ἄραξα Hes. Sc. 364; smash in pieces, τινὰ τῷ ῥοπάλῳ ὥσπερ πίθον παλαιόν D.Chr. 8.31.

data.quote: τινὰ τῷ ῥοπάλῳ ὥσπερ πίθον παλαιόν

children.definition: flecked with white, Babr. 85.15.
water, irrigate, J. BJ 3.10.8 ( Pass.).
Procop. Aed. 6.1 (pl.).

divide by joints, articulate, τὰ στήθη διήρθρου Pl. Smp. 191a:— Pass., διηρθρωμένος well-jointed, well-knit, Hp. Aër. 24, Pl. Phdr. 253d (metaph., πρὸς σωφροσύνην πεπηγὸς καὶ δ. Eun. Hist. p.246 D.); πόδες, δάκτυλοι, Arist. Phgn. 810a16, HA 504a7; to be differentiated, of the embryo, ib. 489b9, cf. Hp. Nat.Puer. 17; to be movable-jointed, Id. Art. 30; esp. to be jointed by διάρθρωσις (q.v.), Gal. 2.656, 18(1).433; also διηρθρωμένον γράμμα a distinct birth-mark (opp. συγκεχυμένον), Arist. GA 721b34.
endue with articulate speech, τὴν γλῶτταν Luc. Dem.Enc. 14, cf. Plu. Dem. 11:— Med., φωνὴν καὶ ὀνόματα διηρθρώσατο τῇ τέχνῃ invented articulate speech and names, Pl. Prt. 322a.

describe distinctly, Id. Lg. 963b, 645c ( Pass.), Porph. Plot. 18, Iamb. VP 23.103, etc.; perceive clearly, distinguish, Phld. D. 1.22, Mus. p.39K., Vit.Philonid. p.9 C.; διηρθρωμένη διάληψις Porph. Abst. 2.43; opp. συγκεχυμένος, Id. Marc. 10.

complete in detail, fill up so as to form an organic whole, lit., πρὶν διηρθρῶσθαι τὸ σῶμα Arist. HA 521a10 ( Act. δ. σάρκα τῇ γλώττῃ of a bear licking its cub into shape, Ael. NA 6.3): metaph., Arist. EN 1098a22:— Pass., Id. Metaph. 986b6; ἂν διαρθροῖτο ὁ συλλογισμός Id. Top. 156a20.
distinguish, τὸ γένος A.D. Synt. 138.24.
articulation, τῶν μελέων Hp. Nat.Puer. 18; differentiation, δ. λαμβάνειν, of the embryo, Arist. HA 583b23, cf. GA 744b11; of the Universe, Epicur. Ep. 2p.38U. (pl.).

children.label: b
children.definition: movable articulation, diarthrosis (opp. συνάρθρωσις), Gal. 2.735, 18(1).433.
articulate utterance, Arist. HA 535a31; ἡ τῶν γραμμάτων δ. Id. PA 660a22.
distinct statement, ἠθικῶν ἐννοιῶν, title of work by Chrysipp., Stoic. 2.8, cf. Iamb. Myst. 5.13; distinctness, λόγου Longin. ap. Porph. Plot. 20, cf. Alex.Aphr. in Metaph. 3.14.
one must define precisely, Arist. EE 1248a10, Porph. Abst. 1.31, Simp. in Epict. p.2 D.
explanatory, Epict. Ench. 52; δ. τέχνη S.E. M. 1.300; giving shape or form, Sch. Hes. Th. 139.

reckon up one by one, enumerate, ψήφους E. IT 966, cf. Ar. Av. 1622; τἀργύριον Phld. Ir. p.37 W.; ὑπολείποι ἂν ὁ αἰὼν διαριθμοῦντα Arist. Rh. 1374a33:—more freq. in Med., as Pl. Cra. 437d, Phdr. 273e, al.; count and classify, Id. Grg. 501a; διαριθμήσασθαι περί τινος Id. Lg. 633a:— Pass., Aeschin. 3.207, Arist. Ph. 322b30.
count out, pay, δωρεάν τισι App. BC 4.101.
reckoning up, χρημάτων Plu. Aud.poet. 2.27c; χρόνου Theo Sm. p.148 H.
Epict. Ench. 52.
mustard, Hsch., prob. in Polyaen. 4.3.32.
= Lat. diarium, day-wage, POxy. 1729 (iv A. D.), etc.

definition: διαρίπτω, poet. for διαρρίπτω, dub. l. in Ar. Th. 665 (lyr.).

children.definition: eat at breakfast for a wager, βοῦν αὐτῷ δ. eat an ox against another, Ath. 9.412f.
strive for the pre-eminence, πρός τινα Longin. 13.4.
sufficiency, τῆς τροφῆς Thphr. CP 1.11.6.
suffice, τρία ἔπεα διαρκέσει Pi. N. 7.48, cf. X. Cyr. 6.2.26, Phld. Herc. 1251.19, etc.; πρός τι Thphr. CP 1.16.4; endure, hold out, Isoc. 2.19; δ. πρός τινα hold out against . ., Luc. Luct. 24, etc.

endure, last, A. Th. 842 (lyr.); οὐ διήρκεσε δεῦρο ὁ λόγος Pl. Ti. 21d: c. part., δ. πολιορκούμενος X. HG 5.3.21; δ. ἐπὶ πολὺν χρόνον Arist. Mete. 352b4; οὐ διήρκεσε τῷ βίῳ πρὸς τὸ τοῦ πολέμου τέλος Plu. Fab. 27; ἀπόσιτος [ὢν] ἐς ἑβδόμην δ. Luc. Hist.Conscr. 21.

data.quote: οὐ διήρκεσε τῷ βίῳ πρὸς τὸ τοῦ πολέμου τέλος

children.label: II
children.definition: supply nourishment, τινί Plu. Sol. 22; sustain, τινάς Aeschin. Ep. 5.3.
sufficient, χώρα Th. 1.15; τροφή Arist. HA 626a2, Thphr. CP 1.11.6; δυνάμεις D.H. 4.23, etc.

lasting, ὠφέλεια D. 3.33; ἐπὶ πολύ D.H. 6.54: Comp., Luc. Anach. 24: Sup., with staying power, of an athlete, Paus. 6.13.3; ἵπποι Them. Or. 11.146a. Adv. -κῶς S.E. P. 3.115, Eun. Hist. p.209D., Demoph. Sent. 10, etc.; δ. ἔχειν τι to be amply provided with, Procop. Pers. 1.21, al.: Sup. διαρκέστατα ζῆν in complete competence, X. Mem. 2.8.6.
sufficiently, dub. l. in J. AJ 14.13.9.
passage by sea, Plb. 10.8.2, Agathem. 3.13; crossing of a channel, Str. 4.5.2.

children.label: II
children.definition: elevation of style, ὄγκος καὶ δ. Plu. Comp. Arist. Men. 2.853c, Longin. 12.1; δ. ψυχῆς λαβεῖν D.L. 9.7.

children.label: III
children.definition: Hsch.
distribute in various places, E. Or. 1451 (lyr.): hence,
Med., arrange, dispose, ταῦτα πρὸς τὸ μέλλον Plb. 8.25.5:— Pass., τὸν τρόπον τοῦτον διηρμοσμένοι ib. 7.1; regulate, τὸν βίον Plu. Util. 2.88a.
deny, Petr. Patr.p.434D., Just. Nov. 18.10.
gaps left in applying a bandage, Hp. ap. Erot. ( -ροχαί codd.); cf. διαρωχμίας.
plot of two ἄρουραι, PBas. 17.3 (i A. D.).
plough, A.R. 3.1053 (tm.).
plundering, Hdt. 9.42, Plb. 10.16.6, PMasp. 4.13 (vi A. D.).

definition: διαρπάζω, fut. -άσομαι Pl. R. 336b, later -άσω App. Pun. 55:—

children.definition: tear in pieces, [ λύκοι] αἶψα διαρπάζουσι [ἄρνας] Il. 16.355; of the wind, carry away, efface, τὰ ἴχνη X. Cyn. 6.2; τείχη διηρπασμένα dismantled, Jul. ad Ath. 279a (7).

children.label: II
children.definition: spoil, plunder, πόλιν Hdt. 1.88, etc.:— Med., Συρίαν J. AJ 1.9.1.

seize as plunder, χρήματα Hdt. l.c., cf. Lys. 7.6, 19.40, Hell.Oxy. 13.3, Arist. Pol. 1281a25, etc.:— Pass., Pl. Plt. 274b; τἀν τῇ Βοιωτίᾳ διαρπασθησόμενʼ ὑπὸ τοῦ πολέμου D. 18.213, cf. Lys. 19.41, Th. 8.36.

data.quote: τἀν τῇ Βοιωτίᾳ διαρπασθησόμενʼ ὑπὸ τοῦ πολέμου

children.definition: snatch from, θηρείων παῖδα γενείων Nonn. D. 48.290.
tearing apart, ὀστέων Hp. Coac. 184.

sprinkle, κόνιν Philostr. Gym. 56; shed, ἀκτῖνας Lyd. Ost. 10a; besprinkle, LXX l.c.; purify by lustration, οἰκίην IG 12(5).593A17 (Ceos, Pass.):— Pass., ἀφρῷ ἡ γῆ διέρρανται Philostr. Im. 7.27:—also intr. in Act., Lyd. Ost. 9b.

children.label: II
children.definition: Pass., to be diffused, dissipated, S. Tr. 14, Arist. Mete. 341a30.

dash in pieces, destroy, διαρραῖσαι μεμαῶτες Il. 2.473, etc.; οἶκον Od. 2.49:— Pass., c. fut. Med., to be destroyed, perish, τάχα δʼ ἄμμε διαρραίσεσθαι ὀΐω Il. 24.355; διαρραισθέντας εἰς Ἅιδου μολεῖν A. Pr. 238.

children.label: II
children.definition: ῥωχμαὶ σάρκα διαρραίουσι dub. in Marc.Sid. 80.
seam, Plu. Sollert. 2.978a.
cuff soundly, Hld. 7.7, 8.9 ( Pass.).
one must insert a suture, Archig. ap. Orib. 47.13.5.
sew through or together, Str. 15.1.67, Plu. Sollert. 2.978a; insert a suture, Gal. 18(2).746.
sewing up, Sor. 2.40.
carve, Eub. 15.4 ( Pass.).
dawdle, Anon. ap. Suid. s.v. ῥεμβώδης.
oscillate: halt in oneʼs gait, Hp. Art. 55.

flow through, διὰ μέσου Hdt. 7.108; δ. μέσου αὐτοῦ Ael. VH 3.1: c. acc., τὴν χώραν Isoc. 11.14; δ. εἰς τὴν θάλατταν, of rivers, Arist. HA 569a20:— Pass., Epicur. Ep. 2p.47U.; to be drenched, ἱδρῶτι Hld. 10.13; of a country, ποταμοῖς διαρρεῖσθαι Plu. Frig. 2.951f: also intr. in Act., τὸ ἔδαφος διαρρέον καὶ τὴν ἰκμάδα παρέχον Thphr. Ign. 41.

data.quote: τὸ ἔδαφος διαρρέον καὶ τὴν ἰκμάδα παρέχον

children.definition: slip through, τῶν χειρῶν Luc. Anach. 28; διὰ τῶν δακτύλων Id. DMort. 7[17].1.
fade away, die away, Plu. Aem. 24.
χείλη διερρυηκότα gaping lips, Ar. Nu. 873.

children.label: II
children.definition: fall away like water, die or waste away, χάρις διαρρεῖ S. Aj. 1267; of the moon, wane, πάλιν διαρρεῖ κἀπὶ μηδὲν ἔρχεται Id. Fr. 871.8; to be ‘boiled to rags’, Ar. V. 1156; of money, μὴ λαθεῖν διαρρυὲν τἀργύριον D. 37.54; of soldiers, δ. ἐκ τῆς στρατοπεδείας Plb. 1.74.10; δ. κατὰ πόλεις Plu. Sull. 27, etc.; also δ. ὑπὸ πλούτου καὶ μαλακίας, Lat. diffluere luxuria, Id. Aud.poet. 2.32d, cf. Ages. 14, Luc. DMort. 21[11].4, etc.; δ. τῷ βίῳ lead a loose life, Ael. VH 9.24.
fragment, prob. in Hsch. s.v. κεάσματα.

break through, Hom. only in Med., διά τε ῥήξασθαι ἐπάλξεις Il. 12.308; διαρρήξασα χαλινόν having broken the bridle asunder, Thgn. 259; μόγις ἂν . . διαρρήξειας [τὴν κεφαλήν] Hdt. 3.12; πλευρὰν διαρρήξαντα . . φασγάνῳ having cloven it, S. Aj. 834; δ. τὰς χορδάς Pl. Phd. 86a:— Pass., burst, as with eating, X. Cyr. 8.2.21, Anaxil. 25, Phoenicid. 3, etc.; δ. μυρίων ἀγαθῶν Men. 10D.; with passion, διαρραγήσομαι Ar. Eq. 340; ὑπὸ φθόνου Luc. Tim. 40; οὐδʼ ἂν σὺ διαρραγῇς ψευδόμενος D. 18.21, cf. 87; διαρραγείης, as a curse, ‘split you!ʼ Ar. Av. 2, etc.: pf. διέρρωγα to be broken or torn, διερρωγυιῶν τῶν χορδῶν Pl. Phd. l.c.; ἀκεσαμένη τὸ διερρωγός Arist. HA 623a18; ὑπόδημα δ. Plu. Profect. 2.82b: later pf. part. Pass. διερρηγμένος Jul. Or. 2.64c.

expressly, explicitly, h.Merc. 313, Plb. 3.26.5; esp. of legal enactments or treaties, δ. γέγραπται Foed. ap. And. 2.14; δ. εἴρηται μή . . Lys. 1.20; ὁ νόμος δ. λέγει Is. 3.68; δ. ψηφίσασθαι D. 19.6; δ. πέμπειν Pl. Lg. 698c; νομοθετεῖν ib. 876c.
plotter, Hsch.
Epicur. Ep. 2p.49U., J. AJ 18.9.1, Herod.Med. in Rh.Mus. 49.552.
explicit enactment, Pl. Lg. 932e, dub. in Leg.Gort. 9.36.
Babr. 38.7, Ev.Luc. 8.29, Artem. 4 Praef.:— Pass., Ps.-Callisth. 1.46.
draw up and twist the body, of an unseemly kind of dance, Cratin. 219.
casting about, questing, of a hound, X. Cyn. 4.4 (pl.).

file through or perforate, Hero Aut. 25.5, Sor. 2.63: pf. part. Pass. διερρινημένος perforated, ἐπίθημα Arist. Ath. 68.3, cf. Dsc. 4.114: metaph., fine, critical, ἀνὴρ λεπτὸς καὶ δ. τὴν γαστέρα Max.Tyr. 36.4.f.

data.quote: ἀνὴρ λεπτὸς καὶ δ. τὴν γαστέρα

children.definition: filing through, perforation, Heliod. ap. Orib. 47.17.4.
blow away, disperse, Hld. 3.7: metaph. in Pass., Id. 9.14.

children.label: II
children.definition: expose to draughts, Hp. Ep. 16 ( Pass.).

definition: διαρρίπτω, poet. διαρίπτω, also pres. διαρριπτέω Ar. V. 59, X. Cyn. 5.8, Aeschin. 1.59, etc.:—

children.definition: shoot through, διαρρίπτασκεν ὀϊστόν Od. 19.575.

cast or throw about, διάριψον ὄμμα πανταχῇ fling glances round, dub. in Ar. Th. 665; τὰς ὄψιας πυκνὰ δ. Hp. Coac. 214; δ. σκέλεα Id. Prog. 3 ( Pass.); δ. τὴν οὐράν, of a dog, wag the tail, X. Cyn. 6.23.

throw about, as nuts, etc., among a crowd, Ar. V. 59; χρήματά τισι Plb. 16.21.8: metaph., toss about, Pl. Ep. 343d; squander, τὸν βίον Lib. Or. 12.33: pf. part. Pass., indiscriminate, Pl. Lg. 860c; scattered, dispersed, δ. κατὰ πόλεις Plu. Phil. 8; διερριμμένην μνήμην ποιήσασθαι mention here and there, Plb. 3.57.5.
throw down, τὸν περίβολον Id. 16.1.6.

children.label: II
children.definition: plunge, ἐν τῇ θαλάττῃ X. Cyn. 5.8.
casting about, ποδός Pratin.Lyr.1.14.
scattering, X. An. 5.8.7, Thphr. HP 6.3.4.
compounded of roses, κολλούριον Gal. 12.765.
channel, pipe, πνεύματος διαρροαί the wind- pipe, E. Hec. 567; of a stream, αἱ δ. τοῦ Ῥειτοῦ SIG 86.15 ( Eleusis, v B. C.).

children.label: II
children.definition: flowing through, ἡ ἄνω τε καὶ κάτω τοῦ ὠκεανοῦ διαρροή, ebb and flow, D.C. 39.41.
to roar or rustle through, διαρροθῆσαι κάκην τινί to inspire fear by clamour, A. Th. 192.

children.label: II
children.definition: διαροθεῦντα· διασοβοῦντα, Hsch.
flowing through, diarrhoea, Hp. Aph. 3.21 (pl.), Ar. Fr. 150, Th. 2.49, Pl. Ti. 85e (pl.), Arist. HA 605a27; δ. κοιλίας Plu. Mar. 30; δ. εἰς οὖρα diabetes, Gal. 7.81.
to whizz through, διερροίζησε στέρνων [ὁ ἰός] S. Tr. 568.
suffer from diarrhoea, Dsc. 4.88, Arr. Epict. 4.10.11, Alex.Aphr. Pr. 1.98.
suffering from diarrhoea, Ruf. ap. Orib. 7.26.6.
assume the figure of a rhombus, Hero Metr. 1.16.
rhomboid, of a bandage, Hippiatr. 74.
passage, channel, D.S. 13.47, Str. 4.1.2, Sch. Il. Oxy. 221i17.
flowing away, vanishing, φόνος πέπηγεν οὐ δ. A. Ch. 67 (lyr.).
adjust, κανόνα IG 1(2).373.70; arrange in order, LXX 2 Ma. 7.22.
scatter, dissipate, in aor. 1, Hsch.
deliver, τινὰ ἐκ τοῦ δεσμωτηρίου Ph. 1.95.
cleansing, φάρμακα Gal. 11.744.
cleanse thoroughly, τοὺς πόρους Gal. 6.261; κηλῖδα Lib. Decl. 33.31.
Hero Spir. 1.1, al.
intersected by streams, Str. 5.1.7, Epic. in Arch.Pap. 7.7; διαρρύτους· διηντλημένους, Hsch.
gap, interstice, left in applying a bandage, Hp. Art. 35.
rent asunder, δ. κυμάτων σάλῳ ἀγμός a broken cliff rent asunder by the waves, E. IT 262; πέτραι Opp. H. 3.212.

children.label: II
children.definition: Subst., rent, of the Straits of Messina, ib. 5.216.
raising up, ἱστίων D.S. 3.40; ἡ ἐκ διάρσεως μάχη fight with broadswords, Plb. 2.33.5.

children.label: II
children.definition: Longin. 8.1.
tax of two ἀρτάβαι, PTeb. 2p.178.
paying two ἀρτάβαι of rent, POxy. 1031.12 (iii A. D.).
speak fitly, dub. l. in A. Fr. 318 (fort. διάρτισον).
cut limb-meal, A. Pr. 1023, Anaxandr. 6; διαρταμῶντες (as if from -αρταμάω) [σώματα] κατὰ μέλη is cj. in Ph. 2.564.
suspend, Hsch., dub. l. for διαττᾶσθαι, Plb. 34.9.10.
keep in suspense, keep engaged, τινί in or by . ., D.H. 1.46; mislead, deceive, Men. 1006.

children.label: II
children.definition: to separate, διδύμους Ph. 2.303, al., cf. Heliod. ap. Orib. 44.10.5; τὴν δύναμιν ἀπὸ Συρακουσῶν Plu. Tim. 25; διηρτημένα ἀπʼ ἀλλήλων Str. 5.3.7: c. gen., σῶμα τοῦ ὅλου διαρτηθέν Ph. 2.509; dismember, Plot. 6.9.5; interrupt, τὰς ἀκολουθίας D.H. Dem. 40; διηρτημένων τῶν λέξεων forced apart, Id. Comp. 20; διηρτημένων . . φωνῶν Demetr.Lac. 1014.48 F.; διηρτῆσθαι, of argument, to lack connexion, be incoherent, διηρτημένα τινὰ καὶ ψευδῆ ib. 46F., cf. S.E. P. 2.153.

children.label: III
children.definition: Hsch. ( Pass.).
incoherence, irrelevance, κατὰ διάρτησιν λόγος a non-sequitur, Stoic. 2.79 (perh. Chrysipp.).
mould, form, LXX Jb. 33.6; speak fitly, Hsch.
moulding, shaping, EM 361.8, Suid.; composition, prob. l. for διάρτησις, Gal. 15.102.
dress, prepare: metaph., πλάσις εἰς τὴν τῶν πολεμίων ἀπάτην διηρτυμένη Eun. Hist. p.248D.

data.quote: πλάσις εἰς τὴν τῶν πολεμίων ἀπάτην διηρτυμένη

definition: διαρύτω, strengthd. for ἀρύτω, Hsch., EM 270.3.

children.definition: the Hellenodicae, Hsch.
hold office to the end, Lys. Fr. 177S., D.C. 40.66: c. acc. cogn., στρατηγίαν τὴν οἴκοι Id. 36.41.
σαίνω, ταῖς οὐραῖς X. Cyn. 4.3.
grin, sneer, Plu. Mar. 12.

definition: διασαλακωνίζω, strengthd. for σαλακωνίζω, Ar. V. 1169; but perh. better διασαικωνίζω, cf. Id. Fr. 849.

children.definition: agitated motion, Marcellin. Puls. 500.
shake violently, Plb. 1.48.2, Luc. VH 2.5; of missiles, Plb. 16.30.4; κλεῖθρα Corn. ND 30.

confuse, τὰς ἁρμονίας, τοὺς ἤχους, D.H. Comp. 22, 23; cause excitement in, πόλιν Luc. Alex. 31; διασεσαλευμένος τὸ βάδισμα negligent, easy in gait, Id. Rh.Pr. 11; δ. τὸ βλέμμα, of an ogler, Id. Merc.Cond. 35.

children.label: II
children.definition: Arist. Phgn. 809b32.
ἐπʼ ἀγκυρῶν App. BC 5.89.

definition: διασαρκωνίζω, = foreg., Hsch. (also δια-σαρωνίζω); but διασαρκών-ισμα· ἀσελγές τι σχῆμα, Id.

children.definition: stuff with a thing, αἵματι καὶ σαρξίν Gal. 1.32: pf. part. Pass. διασεσαγμένος Archig. ap. eund. 8.931; δ. ὑπό, c. gen., gorged with . ., Macho ap. Ath. 6.244c: c. gen., Gp. 19.9.5: c. dat., σκυβάλοις Ruf. ap. Orib. 8.24.13.

definition: διασαυλόομαι, strengthd. for σαυλόομαι, Ar. Fr. 624.

children.definition: make quite clear, show plainly, ἐλπίδας οὔσας κενάς E. Ph. 398; τι Pl. Lg. 916e, Phld. Lib. p.13O., etc.; δ. εἴτε . . εἴτε μή Pl. Prt. 348b, cf. Phld. Po. 5.13; also δ. περί τινος make a clear statement about . ., Arist. de An. 404b1; δ. εἰς Καρχηδόνα περί τινος send clear information . ., Plb. 3.87.4; δ. ὑπέρ τινος Id. 2.19.13; instruct plainly, ἵνα . . Id. 4.26.3, LXX 2 Ma. 1.18; ὅπως PEleph. 18.3 (iii B. C.):— Med., dub. in PPar. 70p.413:— Pass., Arist. EN 1094b12, etc.
make clear, X. Mem. 3.1.11, Ap. 1; τινὶ τὰ πεπραγμένα D.H. 11.33, cf. Aët. 13.15:— Pass., Hero Bel. 98.6:

definition: διασαφηνέω, = foreg., dub. in Hp. Ep. 12.

children.definition: explanation, interpretation, LXX Ge. 40.8.
one must make quite clear, Arist. de An. 416b30; ὑπέρ τινος Thphr. CP 6.14.5.
affirmative, σύνδεσμος A.D. Conj. 221.23; explanatory, Sch. Ar. Av. 825, An.Ox. 1.188; declaratory, EM 415.27.
LXX 2 Ma. 1.21.
succussion, of the spine, Gal. 18(1).520.

children.label: II
children.definition: PTeb. 41.30 (ii B. C.).
extortion, BGU 1138.11 (i B. C.).
abuse of power, extortion, συκοφαντία καὶ δ. PTaur. 1v1 (ii B.C.), cf. PTeb. 43.36 (ii B.C.), POxy. 1252133 (iii A. D.).
shaken about, ἀστράγαλοι Aeschin. 1.59, cf. Men. 423; κύβοι Poll. 7.203.

shake violently, Hp. Morb. 1.6, dub. in Arist. Ath. 64.2; τι εἰς ἀταξίαν Pl. Ti. 85e, cf. 88a; τὴν κεφαλήν Plu. Def.orac. 2.435c: c. dat., δ. τοῖν χεροῖν Aeschin. Socr. 50; δ. τῇ οὐρᾷ to keep wagging the tail, X. Cyn. 6.15:— Med., shake people off, shake oneself free, D.H. 1.56.

confound, throw into confusion, τὰ τῶν Ἀθηναίων φρονήματα Hdt. 6.109; τοὺς ἀκούοντας Plb. 18.45.2; intimidate, oppress, Id. 10.26.4, cf. OGI 519.14 ( Pass.); browbeat, PTaur. 1viii13 (ii B.C.); extort money by intimidation from a person, PPar. 15.37 (ii B.C.), Ev.Luc. 3.14, etc.: c. gen., PTeb. 41.10 (ii B.C.):— Pass., POxy. 284.5 (i A. D.).
throw into confusion, Plu. Cic. 10.
stir up, in Pass., Dam. Pr. 29.
sound, take the measure of, Plu. Gen.Socr. 2.580d, QConv. 704d.

dart through, used by Hom. only in 3 sg. Ep. aor. Pass. διέσσῠτο, c. gen., τάφροιο δ. Il. 10.194; αἰχμὴ δὲ στέρνοιο δ. 15.542; ἐκ μεγάροιο δ. Od. 4.37: less freq. c. acc., δ. λαὸν Ἀχαιῶν Il. 2.450: abs., αἰχμὴ δὲ δ. [μηροῦ or μηρόν] 5.661: later in part. διεσσύμενος Q.S. 3.641: pf. διέσσυται Opp. H. 2.259.
sift, Hp. VM 3, Dsc. 5.75; prob. for διασείσας, Diocl. ap. Orib. 8.41.3:— Pass., Aret. CA 2.3.
weigh, Suid. s.v. βαστάσας.
mark out, point out clearly, τι Hdt. 5.86, X. An. 2.1.23; τινί τι Id. Oec. 12.11.
indicate by a signal, σάλπιγγι τὸν καιρὸν τῆς προσβολῆς Plb. 10.12.4.

children.label: II
children.definition: Med., note the bearings of, τόπους Arist. HA 549b17.
approve, D.S. 19.15.
signify, Str. 17.1.6, Plu. Dem. 19.

children.label: III
children.definition: show its symptoms, appear, Hp. Aph. 6.41.
method of marking, Ptol. Alm. 7.4, 8.3 (pl.).
cause to be placed on record, Inscr. Magn. 117.3 (ii A. D.).
clear, distinct: neut. pl. as Adv., διάσημα θροεῖ S. Ph. 209 (lyr.).

children.label: II
children.definition: conspicuous, eminent, Hippias Soph. 4 ( Sup.), Plu. Dio 54; δ. κράνος Id. TG 17; γένει καὶ ἀξίᾳ BMus.Inscr. 481*.15 (ii A. D.): esp. in Sup., διασημοτάτη πόλις Epigr.Gr. 904 ( Erythrae); διασημότατος, = Lat. clarissimus, IG 3.635; = perfectissimus, δ. ἡγεμών BGU 198.5 (ii A. D.), al., Epigr.Gr. 1078.10 ( Adana); ἐπίτροπος Sammelb. 4421.5 (iii A. D.).

cause to putrefy, χρῶτα Str. 15.1.37, cf. Dsc. 2.173, Gal. 18(2).455; τοῦ κακοῦ -σήψαντος τὰ οὖλα Ael. NA 9.62:—freq. in Pass., with pf. διασέσηπα, putrefy, Thphr. HP 5.7.5, Luc. Luct. 18; διασαπεὶς τὸν πόδα Id. Alex. 59.
to be exhausted, of soil, POxy. 1502v6 (iii A. D.).
the festival of Zeus μειλίχιος, at Athens, Ar. Nu. 408, Th. 1.126, etc. [ ᾰς Ar. l.c., cf. Sch. ad v. 862.]
hiss or whistle violently, Aeschin.Socr. 50.
mock, jeer at, c. acc., Luc. Lex. 24; πράγματα καὶ δόγματα Iamb. Protr. 21.λαʹ; τινὰ ἐπί τινι Alciphr. 3.62.
remain silent, E. Hel. 1551, X. Mem. 3.6.4.
pause in reading, Gal. 16.742, al.

children.label: II
children.definition: pass over in silence, E. Ion 1566; also in Dor. fut., διασωπάσομαί οἱ μόρον Pi. O. 13.91.
bound through, dart along, A.R. 1.574.
= sq., Plu. Sollert. 2.980e, Hsch. s.v. διαγλάψασʼ.
pick over, τὸν ὄνθον Arist. Fr. 354.
feed on chervil ( σκάνδιξ), Telecl. 38: hence Com. for διευριπιδίζω, to come Euripides over one (his mother was said to be a λαχανόπωλις), Ar. Eq. 19.

dig through, ἰσθμόν Paus. 2.1.5; δ. τὰ τείχη make a breach in them, Lys. 13.14; ῥόως τῷ ὕδατι make a breach for water in the canals, Tab.Heracl. l.c., cf. Ph. Bel. 98.27: also c. gen., τοῦ τείχους Plu. Pyrrh. 33; excavate, τάφον Charito 8.7.
sketch in outline: hence, slur over, τὰς εὐτυχίας . . διεσκαριφησάμεθα καὶ διελύσαμεν Isoc. 7.12.

children.label: II
children.definition: Act., scratch the ground, of birds, Hsch.
to be befouled or filthy, ἄνανδρος καὶ διεσκατωμένη τρυφή, of the Epicureans, Diog.Sinop. 1.
disperse a tumour, Aët. 15.15.

definition: διασκεδάννυμι, Att. fut. -σκεδῶ S. Ant. 287, Ar. V. 229, etc.:—

children.definition: scatter abroad, scatter to the winds, δούρατα Od. 5.370; τῷ κέ τοι ἀγλαΐας γε διασκεδάσειεν 17.244; γῆν ἐκείνων καὶ νόμους διασκεδῶν S. l.c.; τὰ νῦν ξύμφωνα δεξιώματα δόρει διασκεδῶσιν Id. OC 620; διασκεδᾶτε τὸ προσὸν νῦν νέφος Anaxandr. 58; of the wind, διεσκέδασεν αὐτὰ (sc. ναυάγια καὶ νεκροὺς) πανταχῇ Th. 1.54: metaph., BGU 1253.12 (ii B.C.):— Pass., Eus.Mynd. 63.

data.quote: τῷ κέ τοι ἀγλαΐας γε διασκεδάσειεν
τὰ νῦν ξύμφωνα δεξιώματα δόρει διασκεδῶσιν

children.definition: Hdt., τὸν στρατὸν διεσκέδασε disbanded it, 1.77, cf. 79:— Pass., 1.63, 5.15, Th. 3.98, D.C. 47.38; δ. κατʼ ἑωυτοὺς ἕκαστοι Hdt. 8.57 (but also of an enemy, scatter, 8.68.β).
disperse the soul, when it leaves the body, Pl. Phd. 77e, cf. 70a, 78b.
Pass., of reports, to be spread abroad, Hdn. 7.6.9.
reject, βουλήν LXX 3 Ki. 12.24.
scattering, Thd. Is. 24.19.
scattering, Hsch. s.v. Φαραά.
scatterer, as Adj., extravagant, reckless, τρόπος Ph. 1.89.
fitted for dispersing or digesting, ἀρχομένης ὑποχύσεως Dsc. 3.80, cf. 5.115.

definition: διασκελίδα· σπυρίδα ἣν ἔνιοι διασκάλων, Hsch.

children.definition: having the legs parted, σῶμα διεσκελισμένον PMag.Par. 1.2309; δ. καθῆσθαι Eust. 1038.10, cf. EM 502.39.
observation, Gal. 1.293 (pl.).
screen, hide, αὐγήν D.C. 60.26.
one must consider, Pl. Lg. 859b, Arist. Pol. 1324a3, etc.
cautious, considerate, Poll. 1.178.
Luc. Vit.Auct. 27, VH 2.18.
get ready, set in order, τι Plb. 15.27.9:— Pass., PTeb. 24.32 (ii B. C.).

children.label: II
children.definition: equip, τινὰ βασιλικῶς Luc. Nec. 16:— Pass., εἰς Σατύρους διεσκευασμένοι dressed as . ., Plu. Ant. 24; ὅπλοις Aen. Tact. 26.1:— Med., prepare for oneself, provide, τἆλλα ὡς ἐς πλοῦν Th. 4.38; arm, equip or prepare oneself, ὡς εἰς μάχην X. HG 4.2.19; διεσκευάσθαι πρὸς τὸν δῆμον Din. 1.70; διασκευάσασθαι πρὸς τοὺς δικαστάς prepare all oneʼs tricks for a trial, X. Ath. 3.7.

children.label: III
children.definition: Med., διασκευασάμενος τὴν οὐσίαν having disposed of oneʼs property, D. 29.3.

children.label: IV
children.definition: revise or edit a work for publication, Aristeas 311, D.S. 1.5.
compile, ἐκ πολλῶν [βιβλίων Gal. 15.10.
elaborate with rhetorical devices, αἰτία μὲν κατασκευάζει, τρόπος δὲ δ. Hermog. Inv. 2.7.

data.quote: αἰτία μὲν κατασκευάζει, τρόπος δὲ δ.

children.definition: Hsch.
reviser, editor of a poem, Sch. Il. 6.441.
descriptive of dress, σχῆμα Eust. 169.31.
construction, Aristeas 64, al.

children.label: II
children.definition: equipment, δ. νομαδική Plb. 8.29.7; δ. πολεμική D.S. 4.38; furniture or vessels, τῆς σκηνῆς LXX Ex. 31.7, cf. Plb. 30.26.3, Agatharch. 8 (pl.).

children.label: III
children.definition: rhetorical elaboration of a topic, Hermog. Inv. 3.15; ποιεῖσθαι τὰς δ. τῶν μύθων Jul. Or. 7.205b.
διασκευαί set phrases, Plb. 15.34.1.

children.label: IV
children.definition: new edition or recension of a work, Aristeas 310, Ath. 3.110b (pl.).

children.label: V
children.definition: Porph. VP 53.

children.label: VI
children.definition: theatrical performance, κωμῳδίαι καὶ δ. D.Chr. 32.94.
revise, rehandle, τι Pl. Ep. 316a:— Med., set in order, τὴν πόλιν Id. R. 540e.
inspection, examination, περί τινος Pl. Lg. 697c, Luc. Anach. 21, Posidon. ap. Gal. 5.469, cf. Lyd. Mag. 1.45: in pl., questions for decision, Plu. Tim. 38.
deck out, in Pass., διησκημένοι τὰς κόμας χρυσῷ Phylarch. 62.

children.label: II
children.definition: train, τινά Luc. Vit.Auct. 9:— Pass., Id. Peregr. 17.

children.label: III
children.definition: practise, ῥητορικά D.L. 4.49.
separate and retire each to his billet ( σκηναί), take up oneʼs quarters, διασκηνῆσαι κατὰ τὰς κώμας X. An. 4.4.8: abs., go into billets, ib. 4.5.29, Lac. 5.3.

children.label: II
children.definition: leave anotherʼs tent, διασκηνούντων μετὰ δεῖπνον Id. Cyr. 3.1.38, dub. in Id. HG 4.8.18.

children.label: III
children.definition: Act., shade, Lyd. Mag. 3.70.
one must take up oneʼs quarters, εἰς στέγας X. An. 4.4.14.
crush, destroy, ὤεα Nic. Th. 193.
pitch like tents at intervals, καπηλεῖα Ael. VH 3.14 ( Pass.).
prop on each side, prop up, AP 6.203 ( Laco or Phil.).

definition: διασκίδνημι, poet. for -σκεδάννυμι, Il. 5.526, Hes. Th. 875, Emp. 84.4, Hdt. 2.25:— Pass., Luc. Dear.Iud. [DDeor. 20].5, Sacr. 13.

children.definition: leap about, LXX Wi. 19.9, Plu. Eum. 11, Philostr.Jun. Im. 10.

definition: διασκοπέω (cf. διασκέπτομαι), fut. διασκέψομαι: aor. διεσκεψάμην: pf. διέσκεμμαι Ar. Ra. 836, but διεσκέφθαι in pass.sense, Id. Th. 687:—

children.definition: look at in different ways, examine or consider well, Hdt. 3.38, E. Cyc. 557, etc.; ἑξῆς δ. τὸν λόγον Pl. R. 350e, cf. Tht. 168e; also δ. πρὸς ἑαυτόν Id. Chrm. 160e; περὶ σφᾶς αὐτούς, περί τινος, Th. 7.71, Pl. Phd. 61e; δ. περί τινος εἰ . . Arist. Pol. 1272a26: c. gen., τῆς ἑαυτῶν ἀσφαλείας D.C. 58.7:— Med., πρὸς τὰ ἔξω διασκοπεῖσθαι Th. 6.59: impf., Pl. Plt. 259c.

children.label: II
children.definition: look round one, keep watching, μὴ ὁρῶνται X. Cyn. 9.3.
watch as from a σκοπιά: hence, spy out, σε . . προέηκε διασκοπιᾶσθαι ἕκαστα, of Dolon, Il. 10.388; discern, distinguish, ἀργαλέον . . διασκοπιᾶσθαι ἕκαστον 17.252.

scatter abroad, LXX Ge. 49.7 (v.l.), al.:— Pass., Ev.Jo. 11.52, Plb. 1.47.5, BGU 1049.7 (iv A. D.); squander, οὐσίαν Ev.Luc. 15.13; confound, ib. 1.51; winnow, συνάγων ὅθεν οὐ διεσκόρπισας Ev.Matt. 25.24.
scattering abroad, Zos.Alch. p.178 B.
scattering, dispersal, LXX Ez. 6.8, al.; confusion, τῆς φορολογίας PTeb. 24.55 (ii B. C.).
dissipative, of waste-products, Antyll. ap. Orib. 6.21.30.
jest upon, τινά dub. l. in Plu. Profect. 2.82b; δεῖπνα Ath. 2.55d:— Med., jest one with another, bandy jests, X. Cyr. 8.4.23.
warp, διάσματα, φάρεος ἀρχήν Call. Fr. 244, cf. LXX Jd. 16.13, Ostr. 1155, Nonn. D. 6.151.
wipe or rinse out, ποτήρια Hdt. 2.37.
rub well, ψυχὴ πρὸς ὀξυωπίαν ἑαυτὴν διασμήξασα Hierocl. in CA 21p.467M.:— Pass., ἁλσὶν διασμηχθεὶς ὄναιτʼ ἂν οὑτοσί Ar. Nu. 1237: pf. διέσμηκται Plu. QConv. 2.693d.
rub off, λύματα τρυφαλείης Nonn. D. 30.92.
polish off with the chisel: metaph., δ. βίβλους AP 15.38 ( Cometas); διεσμιλευμέναι φροντίδες refined, subtle theories, Alex. 221.8. Adv. διεσμιλευμένως Poll. 6.150, Hsch.
eyesalves, Gal. 12.257, 806; for a plaster, Asclep. ap. eund. 13.967.
smoulder, πῦρ διασμυχόμενον Ph. 2.143.
scare away, Plu. Sanit. 2.133a; διασεσόβηται ὁ γάμος Hld. 7.26.

children.label: II
children.definition: agitate, excite, Alciphr. Fr. 5, Agath. 3.11:— Pass., to be excited, puffed up, Plu. Aud.poet. 2.32d.
trepidation, M.Ant. 11.22.
quibble like a sophist, Ar. Av. 1619.
very wise, dub. l. in Lyr.Adesp. 135.
squander away, Plu. Cic. 27.

children.label: II
children.definition: Med., plunder, rob, POxy. 71ii12 (iv A. D.).

definition: διασπαθίζω, = foreg. [διασπαθάω] I, Lyd. Mag. 2.19:— Pass., ib. 1.36.

children.definition: torn to pieces, E. Ba. 1220, Ael. NA 12.7.
rend in pieces, A. Pers. 195:— Pass., Eub. 15.3.
δ. τινὰ τῷ λόγῳ Luc. Icar. 21.

children.label: II
children.definition: dilate forcibly, Sor. 2.59.
tearing asunder, forcible separation, Arist. Cael. 313b20, Mete. 372b19, Thphr. Lass. 18, cj. in Epicur. Ep. 2p.44U.

children.label: II
children.definition: gap, Plu. QConv. 2.721a.

definition: διάσπασμα, ατος, τό, = foreg. [διάσπασις] II, Plu. Aem. 20, Polyaen. 4.3.17.

children.definition: tearing in pieces, LXX Je. 15.3, Phld. Piet. 96.

children.label: II
children.definition: interruption, interval, in pl., Plu. Sanit. 2.129b, etc.; παντελὴς δ. complete severance, Dam. Pr. 74: metaph., distraction, τῆς ψυχῆς Phld. Ir. p.29 W.
one must break up, Arist. PA 642b17.
incoherent, disconnected, ἐπιστολαί Alciphr. 2.2.

definition: διασπάω, fut. -σπάσομαι [ᾰ] Ar. Ra. 477, Ec. 1076, also -σπάσω Hdt. 7.236: aor. -έσπᾰσα, Med. -εσπασάμην E. Hec. 1126, Ba. 339, Plu. Caes. 68: pf. -έσπᾰκα Sch. Th. Oxy. 853i15:— Pass., aor. -εσπάσθην: pf. -έσπασμαι (v. infr.):—

children.definition: tear asunder, τοὺς ἄνδρας κρεοργηδὸν δ. Hdt. 3.13, cf. E. and Ar. ll. cc., etc.; ἐμὲ καὶ τὸν ἄνδρα δ. X. Cyr. 6.1.45; δ. τὸ σταύρωμα to break through or tear down the palisade, Id. HG 4.4.10; δ. τὴν γέφυραν, τὸ ἔδαφος, Plb. 6.55.1, Plu. Cam. 5; break up, SIG 364.10 ( Ephesus, iii B. C.): metaph., διασπᾶν τὴν σύμπνοιαν τοῦ παντός Iamb. Protr. 21.λʹ:— Pass., διέσπασται μελέων φύσις Emp. 63; τὸ Ἀττικὸν [ἔθνος] . . διεσπασμένον ὑπὸ Πεισιστράτου Hdt. 1.59; μόνον οὐ διεσπάσθην D. 5.5; δ. ἀπὸ τῶν φίλων to be torn away from . ., Arist. Rh. 1386a10.

separate part of an army from the rest, X. Cyr. 5.4.19; of army and fleet, Hdt. 7.236; δ. τὰς φάλαγγας break them up, Arist. Pol. 1303b13: — Pass., στράτευμα διεσπασμένον an army scattered and in disorder, Th. 6.98, cf. 7.44; of a fleet, Id. 8.104; τῷ διεσπάσθαι τὰς δυνάμεις to be widely scattered, X. An. 1.5.9.

pull different ways, πόλεις distract states, Pl. Lg. 875a; τὰς πολιτείας D. 4.48; τοὺς νόμους X. Cyr. 8.5.25; διέσπακε τὴν ἱστορίαν has broken the continuity of the narrative, Sch. Th. l.c.:— Pass., διασπώμενος distracted, πρὸς τοσαύτας ὑπηρεσίας Luc. DDeor. 4[24].1; ὑπὸ τῶν λόγων Id. Icar. 23.

definition: διασπείρω, aor. 2 Pass. -εσπάρην [ᾰ] S. El. 748, etc.:—

children.definition: scatter or spread about, [τὰς μνέας] . . αὐτοχειρίῃ διέσπειρε τῇ στρατιῇ Hdt. 3.13; διέσπειρε ἡμέας ἄλλην ἄλλῃ τάξας dispersed us, ib. 68; δ. λόγον X. HG 5.1.25; τοὔνομα εἰς τὴν Ἀσίαν Isoc. 5.104; squander, S. El. 1291:— Pass., to be scattered, κρατὸς διασπαρέντος αἵματός θʼ ὁμοῦ Id. Tr. 782; πῶλοι διεσπάρησαν ἐς μέσον δρόμον Id. El. 748; of troops, διεσπαρμένοι Th. 1.11, X. HG 5.3.1, etc.; φύσεις ὁμοίως διεσπαρμέναι equally distributed, Pl. R. 455d, cf. Sph. 260b, etc.; ἡ ψυχὴ διασπείρεται is dissipated, Epicur. Ep. 1p.21U.; τὸ διεσπαρμένον δόγμα the current opinion, Id. Nat. 14.7; τῶν χρωμάτων διεσπαρμένων Ael. NA 11.21.
work zealously, Plb. 4.33.9:— Med., Is. Fr. 56S.; of political factions, D.C. Fr. 83.5, cf. 52.7.

children.label: II
children.definition: incite, c. acc. et inf., Plb. Fr. 126.
all rocky, Peripl.M.Rubr. 43.

definition: διασπλεκόω, strengthd. for σπλεκόω, Ar. Pl. 1082.

children.definition: = Lat. subigitare, Ar. Ec. 939, cf. Hsch. s.v. διεσποδημένη; διεσποδήσατο· διέσεισε, διετίναξε, Id.
scattering, dispersion, Plu. Suav. 2.1105a, LXX Je. 15.7; δ. ψυχική Ph. 2.426.
disperser, Poll. 3.129.

do zealously:—and Pass., to be anxiously done or looked to, τί μάλιστα ἐν ἁπασι διεσπούδασται τοῖς νόμοις; D. 20.157, cf. 23.78: c. inf., δ. μὴ λαβεῖν ὑμᾶς ib. 182; διεσπούδαστο ἐλθεῖν J. AJ 15.8.1; διεσπουδάζετο abs., Arr. An. 7.23.8.

data.quote: τί μάλιστα ἐν ἁπασι διεσπούδασται τοῖς νόμοις;

children.definition: to be zealous, περί τι D.H. Lys. 14.

children.label: II
children.definition: employ electoral corruption, D.C. 36.38: in fut. Med., Id. 52.20.

definition: διᾴσσω, Att. διᾴττω, v. sub διαΐσσω.

children.definition: standing apart, A.R. 2.67; δ. ἀλλήλῃσι apart from . ., Id. 4.942, cf. Opp. H. 1.502.
leak, Gp. 7.8.4; pour off, ἱδρὼς δ. μετώπων Nonn. D. 37.463.
pour, ποτὸν κυπέλλῳ ib. 44.136.

parting, separation (opp. ἕνωσις, Dam. Pr. 273), ὀρέων Hdt. 7.129; ὀστέων Hp. Art. 20, cf. Gal. 19.461; φάραγγες καὶ δ. τῆς γῆς fissures, Arist. Mete. 350b36; breach in a barrier, Ph. Bel. 98.31; opening, τῆς γένυος Aret. CD 1.3.

divorce, Plu. Aem. 5, etc.

Nat. 2.7, cf. Gal. 11.503, S.E. M. 3.19; ἡ δ. ἡ τριχῇ tridimensionality, Plot. 1.2.6, cf. 6.6.17, Porph. Sent. 35, Dam. Pr. 375.

An.procr. 2.1023b; δ. πράγματα Dam. Pr. 375. Adv. -τῶς dimensionally or in extension, Porph. Sent. 33, Syrian, in Metaph. 85.14; opp. νοερῶς, Procl. in Cra. p.55 P.
cut off and fortify with a palisade, D.C. 41.50:— Med., διασταυρώσασθαι τὸν ἰσθμόν to have it fortified, Th. 6.97.

go oneʼs way, ἀνεγρομένη γε διέστιχε Theoc. 27.69; walk, AP 12.85 ( Mel.), Coluth. 215.

put asunder, expand, separate, συνεσταλμένα δ. Hp. Off. 11; τὸν ἀέρα ταῖς πτέρυξιν Arist. IA 713a12; τινὰς ξίφει J. BJ 5.2.2; δ. τι ταῖς ὄνυξι to tear it open, Plu. Thes. 36:— Pass., to be dilated, of the lungs or heart, Arist. Aud. 800b2, Gal. 2.657, al.; διασταλέντα τὰ ὑγρά being dispersed, Arist. Pr. 891a2; διασταλήτω πᾶσα σκοτία let all darkness be dispelled, PMag.Par. 1.2472.
divide, δίχα Pl. Plt. 265e; distinguish, τοὺς Τρῶας τῶν Δαρδάνων Sch. Il. Oxy. 1086.115; τῷ τόνῳ POxy. 1012 Fr. 16.5 ( Pass.).

D. 3 Fr. 8: c. acc., Pl. R. 535b:— Pass., διεσταλμένος definite, determinate, A.D. Synt. 37.7, al.
command expressly, give express orders, ῥητῶς ὑπέρ τινος Plb. 3.23.5; ἐπιτακτικῶς δ. περί τινων D.S. 28.15:— Med., LXX Jd. 1.19, al., PHal. 7.6 (iii B. C.), Ev.Marc. 5.43, etc.
pronounce, χείλεσι LXX Le. 5.4.

pay, render, esp. in kind, POxy. 88.5 (ii A. D.), al.; make an order for payment, Ostr. 1164 (ii/iii A. D.); discharge a vow, LXX Le. 22.21.
set apart, τινὰ ἑαυτῷ ib. 3 Ki. 8.53; τὴν ἱερὰν γῆν PRev.Laws 36.7 (iii B.C.), cf. PTeb. 74.2 (ii B.C.).

children.label: II
children.definition: differ, πρός τινα Plb. 18.47.11.
PRyl. 207a27 (ii A. D.).
very narrow, Gal. 19.444.

interval, freq. in Music, Archyt. 2, Pl. R. 531a, Aristox. Harm. p.4 M., al., Arist. Pr. 922b6, Damox. 2.57; of Time, δ. τετραετές Plb. 9.1.1: generally, ἐκ μεγάλων δ. κινεῖσθαι Democr. 191; δ. μεταξὺ κόσμων Epicur. Ep. 2p.37U.; distance, Phld. D. 3.8,9.

brand, Just. Nov. 115.4.

Piet. 123, Ep.Rom. 3.22; ἁγίων καὶ βεβήλων Ph. 2.159; μετὰ διαστολῆς προενεχθέντα with discrimination, Demetr.Lac. 1014.48 F.; detailed statement or explanation, Plb. 1.15.6; ἀξίους μνήμης καὶ δ. Id. 16.14.2, cf. SIG 284.11 ( Chios), Apollon.Cit. 3; specification of items in an account, PRyl. 65.17 (i B. C.); article in a contract, etc., PTheb.Bank 6.8, 7.7.

Aph. 4.49; ἡ ῥὶς δ. Id. Art. 38; μέλη διεστραμμένα Pl. Grg. 524c; to be warped, τὰ διεστραμμένα τῶν ξύλων Arist. EN 1109b6: also of persons, to have oneʼs eyes distorted, or to have oneʼs neck twisted (Scholl. give both interprr.), εὐδαιμονίζω δʼ εἰ διαστραφήσομαι; Ar. Eq. 175; so ἀπολαύσομαί τί γʼ εἰ δ. Id. Av. 177; of the eyes, διεστράφην ἰδών Id. Ach. 15; τὰ ὄμματα διαστρέφεσθαι Arist. Pr. 960a13; without ὄμματα, ib. 9, cf. 957b7; ὁ διεστραμμένος, opp. ὁ τυφλός, Eup. 276.3; διεστρ. τοὺς πόδας with the feet twisted, Paus. 5.18.1, cf. Arist. Pr. 896b5: of torture, τῇ κλίμακι διαστρέφονται Com.Adesp. 422; διεστράφησαν τὸν στόμαχον had their stomachs turned, Jul. Or. 6.190d.

distort, pervert, [ τρόπον χρηστόν] E. Fr. 597; τοὺς νόμους Is. 11.4; τὸν δικαστήν Arist. Rh. 1354a24; ὑπόληψιν Id. EN 1140b14; τῶν διαστρεφόντων (sc. παθῶν) Phld. Lib. p.32 O.; διαστρέψαντες τἀληθῆ having misrepresented it, D. Prooem. 46.2:— Pass., διαστραφῆναι τὴν διάνοιαν Luc. Vit. Auct. 24; γενεὰ διεστραμμένη perverse, LXX De. 32.5.

perversion, Arist. EE 1227a21; τοῦ δήμου ἐπὶ τὸ χεῖρον Plb. 2.21.8, Porph. Abst. 1.13, etc.; γενῶν Plu. Curios. 2.520c; δ. κακή LXX Pr. 2.14.

make stern, τὰ πρόσωπα Eun. VS 503 D.
space between the columns, Lat. intercolumnium, Bito 54.3.

binding tight, ligature, Sor. 2.41, Heliod. ap. Orib. 10.18, Antyll. ib. 7.9.3, Aret. CA 2.2.
seal up, LXX Je. 39(32).10.
cause to swell up, Hsch.; cf. σφυδόω.
pulsation, φλεβῶν Hp. Alim. 48; ἀρτηρίης Aret. SA 2.2; throbbing, ἐγκεφάλου Id. CD 1.3.
open a vein, Aret. CA 2.10.
Hsch., EM 340.6.
shape, form variously, Str. 17.1.4, Plu. Vitios. 2.499e:— Med., of God, mould as Creator, Pl. Ti. 53b:— Pass., ib. 50c.
shape, model, Luc. Icar. 6, v.l. in Prom. 11 ( Pass.).
shape oneself, prepare, ἐπὶ πρᾶγμα Eun. Hist. p.269D.
formation, i.e. dimensions, of a groove, Procl. Hyp. 3.19: generally, Id. in Ti. 3.261 D.
cloven, split, parted, Ath. 11.488e.

cleave asunder, sever, ἱστία δέ σφιν . . διέσχισεν ἲς ἀνέμοιο Od. 9.71; ἐάν τις ἓν δ. Pl. Phd. 97a, etc.:— Pass., to be cloven asunder, νεῦρα διεσχίσθη Il. 16.316; opp. συγκρίνεσθαι, Pl. Lg. 893e; θοἰμάτιον δ. Id. Grg. 469d; of soldiers, to be separated, parted, X. Cyr. 4.5.13; to be set at variance, διέσχιστο ἡ πόλις Charito 6.1: impers., τούτοις διέσχισται they have a cleft, Arist. Resp. 475a2.
